review: I've only had these headphones for a couple of days, but so far I've been impressed. Took them out of the package, charged them and they paired perfectly with my laptop and my Iphone.  NO issues there. I have problems with fitting earbuds in my ear, so I bought these with the plastic ear wraps.  The ear wraps are soft and flexible and not noticeable.  The earbuds fit great and I have no fear of them falling out. The sound is clear.  The quality is comparable to a decent set of headphones.  It's not going to rock your world, but for the price it definitely does what its supposed to. Battery has lived up to expectations.  I used one ear bud for almost 8 hours before getting the "Low Battery" warning...  I swapped to the other one with no problem at all. The LED indicators in the case show the power level of the case 0-100 which is great.  The individual power bands don't seem to be registering properly, but this isn't a deal breaker for me. I noticed that the listing said "Noise-isolating" not "Noise-canceling."  I didn't expect these to be noise canceling, but they do a decent job of covering background noise, again like a decent pair of headphones. Tomorrow I'm going running in them, so I can't speak to that yet, but I tried really hard to get them to fall out.  I'll update the review after the run. It's definitely worth giving a shot at this price point and as a company they seem interested in building a brand, so they actually care about what you think.

They paired up fairly easily and they sound clear surprisingly. I was a bit skeptical because you never know these days With products on amazon. I originally thought they sent a black pair on accident because the box showed a photo of a black pair but fortunately it was correct. Overall they are a nice replacement for a guy like me who constantly loses their AirPods and don‚Äôt went to spend $150 every time for a new pair

This is a wonderful product! They are very comfortable with a bendable rubber piece that wraps around the ear. The directions are easy to figure out with the pamphlet included. The sound quality is good for the price. I love the compact case that shows the battery life for each ear (which lasts long). All in all 10/10.

Well, so far, so good. Bass is waaay better than another set of sport earbuds I had; it's not thumping, but ir's decent; good enough for me. Also, microphone for phone calls seems to be good, people I've called said they hear me loud and clear, no buzzing or static. I like the case, too, with it's digital display.

These are awesome earbuds and they really have great sound quality! They connect with your bluetooth on the phone under "T17".  I like the design that wraps around my ear.  I find it very comfortable and don't have any issues with the earbuds falling out. They come with 3 different sized silicone pieces so that you can customise You're fit which makes them extra comfortable. I love that these headphones  have a really long battery life, they can last up to 8 hours on one charge and whenever you put them back in the battery case it fully recharges them up to 6 times. That means that I get 48 hours of use out of the earbuds before I need to recharge the case. The case also shows the battery life levels so that I know when to recharge. The volume and bass are great and you can adjust the volume on the earphones themselves or your phone. You can also use them together or just one and theyre grrat for taking calls ot listening to music! Im definitely a fan!

Bought these initially as a back up to my Jlabs ear buds of similar style. These have outperformed the Jlabs in battery life but not quite in sound quality. The sound is quite good but just not quite as crisp as the Jlabs. For online gaming, which I use them most for, these earbuds are now my go to as the Jlabs rarely last more than two to three hours of constant use where the Occiam earbuds last more than 6 hours. (yes, I know, I need to get out more, I blame Covid...) I also like the digital display in the charging case. This indicates how much charge is left in the case battery for recharging. The actual charge of each ear phone is indicated by an LED light bar with a 4 LED  scale for each ear phone. On a side note, I have not paired these with my phone. I probably will when I go hiking and may update the review when that happens. In the end, I am VERY happy with the performance, the battery life and of course the price. I will be buying a second pair of these real soon to be back ups to my first pair.

I had used AirPods from friend even though I didn‚Äôt own one.. and compared the quality of the same with this one and seems really impressive for the money! Good battery life too and this will help me with both my zoom meetings and cardio efforts at the gym! Really a great buy!

Great pair of headphones at the right price point. I have two little kids and I move around a lot at work and I do a lot of chores at home have long days and having a dependable headphones that just work is important. I've had them for a couple weeks and so far they connect to the Bluetooth every time without failure. The sound quality is good I think for the price, no complaints. the most fabulous thing about these headphones is the fit if inside the ear tiny buds don't work for you this might. They are very light and the fit is very lite on the ear. It's lovely. The displays inside the case are fine they're bright they work. The other favorite thing that I like about these headphones is that they have a button instead of a touch pad. And I like a button that clicks. It's more dependable I know it's not going to come on inside of my pocket if I have to throw my headphones inside my pocket at work. Definitely a big button fan over the touchpad. Yeah nothing less than five stars at this price.

I love these headphones! Great price and work the same as most expensive ones. I only wear one at a time when I'm doing things around the house and the sound quality is excellent. The range seems to work pretty well too. I leave my phone in the kitchen a lot to go a level up or a level down in my house and I can still hear crystal clear. My husband was trying to talk to me the other night while I only had one side in and nothing was playing on my phone at the time. He was about 6 feet away and I couldn't make out clearly what he was trying to say so I had to take the piece out. Obviously the noise cancelation part works great! They are also really comfortable and don't hurt the inside of my ear like the style that are just buds do. The charge lasts a long time. I wear one side during most of the day, about 6 hours and never had to recharge it. They come with the charging cord you'd need, its a newer version. The kind that came with my galaxy s10. Pairing is easy as well. I did have one issue with one of the ear buds  sound going in and out but i emailed the customer care team and they quickly responded to resolve the situation. I haven't found anything I dont like about them yet besides you can't travel too far from your connected device but for me the distance is perfect.

Update: first off these are reviewed well due to the company offering a free pair for a 5 start review.. secondly after leaving my negative review I was offered a gift card as a refund only if I removed my negative review.. again spending the extra money and buy from a good company not one that does shady practices.. I liked these headphones initially as a cheap alternative. After minimul use now the charging case will not work at all. There is no way to charge the headphones. Spend the extra money and get better ones

THESE HAVE GONE BEYOND MY EXPECTATIONS AND I LOVE THEM!!!! My husband has wireless headphones and always complains about them not working about 6 months into using them, so I was expecting a cheap pair that would last me a few months and I‚Äôd have to replace. NOPE. These headphones  1. Have great sound quality. 2. The battery life is excellent, I use them all the time and rarely run out of charge/do not charge them that often. 3. Are resilient! Let me tell you a story....... I used these outside working in the yard and left them on my windshield to remind myself to bring them indoors... of course I forgot to bring them in. I also forgot I left them there, so the next morning leaving for work my windshield was frosted so I turned on the wipers and left for work. When I got to work I remembered I forgot them on my windshield. I searched my windshield to not find them anywhere. Devastated that I thought I might have lost them driving on the highway, I was about to order replacements. When I got home I thought, ‚Äúwell maybe the wipers threw them in the driveway.‚Äù SURE ENOUGH I found them in my driveway, they had been sitting in the rain for 4+ hours, AND I RAN THEM OVER.  The darn things still work. The case is cracked but the earpieces themselves are perfect, and they still charge. BUY THESE WIRELESS HEADPHONES!!!!!!!!!!

This pair of Occiam Bluetooth Headphones are the best bluetooth headphones I've ever had. Speaking from a DJs point of view the sound is amazing and it has incredible bass with clear highs. The phone quality is excellent with very clear voice sounds and a very clean microphone for so peaking. The battery life is very good it lasted me all day and I was at 68% at the end of my work day. I would and I am going to highly recommend the Occiam Bluetooth Headphones to anyone who wants a excellent quality pair of headphones at a very affordable price.

Upon receiving this product two days ago, I first charged the case with the earbuds in it, as customary before first usage. After the case was fully charged at 100, I noticed that the left earbud is still charging. So I waited for another 2 hours to give it more time to fully charge. But only the right earbud is fully charged and the left one is still charging. I thought it‚Äôs just a glitch, as it happened sometimes on electronics. So I decided to use it instead of waiting till the left one is fully charged. I‚Äôm really liking it, coz it fit my ears perfectly. I‚Äôm also impressed with the sound, just perfectly balanced for me. But after 3 hours, a prompt voice notify me the left earbud is low battery. Surprised, it supposed to last 8 hrs as stated on its product description. So I charged it again and waited few hrs. Again, the right one fully charged right away. But the left one is still charging. To my disappointment, the left one is still charging. I don‚Äôt think this isn‚Äôt normal. So I emailed the customer service for help. After few emails exchanged, the company decided to send me a new one and let me keep the defective one. I‚Äôm amazed with the courtesy and concern they provided me. Kudos to the great customer service of this company.

Bought these for my fianc√© for work , the sound was good but they have already stopped working on the right side after less then two months( even with only a few hours of use each night and gentle use) . We also were supposed to get a free pair from a card the seller sent with the order but that never happened either.. Won't be buying from them again at this point... Update : so a month later and I get an email from this seller : "I am sorry that there is a problem with the quality of our products. If you are willing to delete your review, we are willing to refund you $ 30 as an apology. We are collecting feedback and improving the product." Steer clear of this seller ,they don't stand behind their products and don't even offer a refund for the purchase price ..

After two weeks of use the left earbud will no longer charge. I have cleaned the contacts on both charger and earbud as instructed. Pretty sad. Update: I have now purchased, returned, and repurchased THREE SETS of these headphones. After 1-2 months of use ALL THREE SETS of them had cutout issues, then stopped charging the left earbud. One manufacturing defect I can handle. BUT THREE IN A ROW? Garbage.

So far I am very happy with the product. My coworkers say the mic picks me up clearly and the audio is good too. My husband said the wires earbuds from Apple are better but if I hadn‚Äôt done a comparison mid call he wouldn‚Äôt have noticed the difference. I like the smallest size ear pads, they are very comfortable for my ear (most are usually too big and hurt after a bit). I like that I can use both or one earbuds as I need or want. I like the storage case and the charge indicator. They pair very easily and and are comfortable to wear. I decided I needed a Bluetooth earbud set after my cat caused a phone catastrophe, getting caught on the wire from my wired earbuds, yanking the phone off the table, and shattering my phone (even with a case on).

UPDATE 04/2021 - The seller sent a new device (thank you; it was much appreciated). I'll give it a try and report whether it was a defective device in a few weeks time. After About 1 month of use, the right piece stopped working. It‚Äôs fully charged and the Bluetooth connection seems to be OK given the controls (volume and next/previous) do respond. Apparently a faulty wire is preventing the audio to work on the right piece. On top of that the quality of the sound is poor, the microphone doesn‚Äôt word well (people can barely hear you in a call) and it‚Äôs not ergonomic at all. I‚Äôll probably just toss it in the trash bin...

I got these for my wife for her birthday to use with her phone.  She uses them very sparingly (like when the baby falls asleep on her so she can watch a show and it doesn't wake him up, etc).  Her birthday is Oct 23. As of today (Feb 8th) the right headphone does not work any longer.  There has been an ongoing issue for 2-3 weeks where the sound would intermittently cut out, but today it stopped working completely.  The return window closed a week ago on Jan 31. If you buy a pair, and both of them continue to work, these are nice headphones (especially for the price), but for whatever reason the right headphone does not work anymore for us.

Not sure where to start how horrible these are. For one thing, the instrutions say peel off the packing on ear pieces, which mine didnt have. Ok, im willing to overlook that no big deal. They also dont lay right in the charger. Turning them on or off is hit or miss (sometimes turning off one turns off the other, sometimes you need to turn off both individually, half the time when I turn them off they somehow turn back on in the case). Sometimes only 1 charges. MOST ANNOYING even after all that is how it obcessary screams BATTERY LOW, over and over when its not.  Edit: after scream on my ears LOW BATTERY, I charge it but it's 99% . EDIT AGAIN: they broke right after warantee period, nor can I even tell who the seller was/is to contact them. Only one headphone works now. Edit: the support is great from the company itself, I think issue was seller. I'll update more if I actually get a new pair.

I have used several types of Bluetooth before now and not happy with one thing or the other about them but, now, I am happy with everything about Occiam Bluetooth Headphone. 1. The Bluetooth fits firmly to ears with its strong hanger 2. The Sound quality of the Bluetooth is 100% satisfactory 3. The Noise cancellation of the Bluetooth is 100% satisfactory 4. The Battery life of the Bluetooth is 100% satisfactory 5. The charger case is not too big or bulky to carry around 6. The charger case charges faster than many other Bluetooth I am sure anyone that buys Occiam Bluetooth Headphone would not regret buying it.

Ok. I was using a different brand and I've had them for 6 months and now the right ear won't seat in the charging case without me having to jimmy-rig-it with a toothpick. I contacted that seller and they didn't ever get back with me. I would have just ordered another set but I didn't want to spend $65 on an item that only lasted for 6 months! I ordered another brand that had great ratings. Got them. Used them. Hated them. Why? Lemme tell you why I love these: First, longevity of these bluetooth headphones is pretty awesome. I sometimes work a 10 hour or 12 hour shift and I need them to last me that long to get thru it. I take lunch at 6 hours, put them back in their charger box and I'm good to go for the last 4 or 6 hours. Also, the other brand I was using before they stopped charging, had control buttons on each ear piece. You have a volume up and down button on the top of the ear piece itself and then on the side or outward facing part of the ear piece is a button for pause and play. It may have another function but I am unsure. The second set I bought did NOT have these features. You had to hold the outward button down for 2 seconds to increase volume, quick button push to pause/play and what if the volume was too high? I didn't know how to fix that. Second, comfort is also a key element. Everybody has different ears. The first day I wore these my left ear didn't like them too much but I wasn't ready to give up yet. It took me a couple of more days to figure out just how to set them in my ear so they were comfortable. Third, sound quality is pretty great! I don't listen to a  lot of music (yeah I know I'm weird) but I do an awful lot of podcasts and audiobooks and if the "readers" sound tinny I don't wanna listen you know? Great balance. I need to be able to hear the low notes or tones and the higher notes sometimes. These are really rounded in sound. I like that. Fourth, cost. $40 was about my price range. I knew I didn't want to spend any less because the quality also goes down with lower prices but I also liked that I didn't have to donate an arm and maybe a leg for these. Fifth, I have yet to use them as a bluetooth connected to my phone for phone calls but I'm sure I'm going to like it a lot. I talk to my parents everyday on the way to work and hands free is essential and EVERYBODY should be hands free but I don't make the laws. My only complaint and it's really quite minor is when I take them out of the case and put them in my ear it takes probably a full 5 to 7 seconds for them to say "CONNECTED". One other thing: the earbud tips, they give you 3 different sizes but I prefer the memory foam ones and I have to remove them to get the earbuds back into the charging case. This is the only thing I would change if I could. Just a little more space in the case for different earbud tips. So A+++

I absolutely loved these headphones when I first got them. They paired easily, had great sound, cancelled noise. It was incredible. Then, inexplicably, the left side stopped working. I could still change volume and pause videos/music by touching the button, but there was absolutely no sound. I tried syncing it on different devices, resetting the headphones, but all to no avail. Only the right side works. That's fine if I only want to use one earbud on mono for calls or something, but to block out all sound and get the good stereo sound I want--not so much. And, of course, my window to return them closed just a few days prior to them crapping out. Just my luck.

This is my first pair of true wireless ear buds. I was impressed with how well they stayed in my ear during my workouts. The sound quality is good, but not nearly as good as my Sony extra bass wireless headset. I was really enjoying them for the first month. The battery life was great. The sound quality was decent. The best part is that they stayed in my ear even during rigorous workouts like Plyometrics. My Sony wireless headset had better sound quality, but they would not stand my ear during workout. With these earbuds, I could use them even while playing soccer. The issue is that they have a 30-day warranty. On day 38, it fell out of my ear onto the floor. My right earbud broke in half. That your hooks are not replaceable. You have to buy it a whole new set. So, they get two stars because they fit so well and have a great battery life and decent sound. But the plastic that holds everything together is really cheap.

So coworker of mine chomps her gun so loud that I could hear it in my old head phones and needed to have the sound up so high it would give me a headache but I HATE when people eat like they were born in a barn!!! And no matter how many times I asked her to stop she would for a bit then it would sound like a cow eating ü§Æ anyway so I got these headphones to see if it would help and these work so good!!! I can have it at a normal sound level and I can't hear my coworker plus it gives me the flexibility to move around with out having to carry my phone!!

I loved these so much, that after 1 day, of receiving them. I bought a pair for my friend. These are the perfect set for work from home and conference calls that you get on. Since I am a Database Administrator for a health care organization, these are perfect, since I need to type lot in my work. You can also listen to music, without disturbing others. One of the most amazing features it that you can use one or the other and they both have the ability to control your phone. One other feature that is also amazing is, you can use one, while the other is charging, and switch between the two, which doubles your talk time.  It also means that you will always have a fully charged and ready one to use. Lewie

Won't fall out of ear but if wearing a facemask the buds entangle with the mask. Easy to use, just charge up earbud bank and it will charge the buds for one week (I use one ear bud for each use). Battery life is ok, one bud lasts from morning till almost evening with spaced out use. Got into the routine of giving a bud a break and switch out buds mid evening. Sound quality is also ok but not great, if using high volume the music distorts and garbles, but I like a medium low level anyways so its not an issue. I've been able to pair my 2 phones fairly easily with these buds, but sometimes pairing can be stubborn so I just pop em back into the charger bank and start over, usually it corrects this way. Nosie cancellation is great, I was able to hear my music while vacuuming on the highest volume.

I bought these to replace a similarly priced TBI set I lost. I use these for connecting to my Hydrow row machine for about 30 mins a day. I don't ask for much. These connect to my rower... sometimes.  Both L and R connect... sometimes.  When they work, sound quality is just fine. I missed the return window so throwing in the trash and going back to the TBI brand.

Product arrived in nice packaging.  I'll test these out at the gym tomorrow.  Love the look and they feel very comfortable.  Will test the battery life once they are fully charged. UPDATE: Successful time at the gym wearing these.  The sound was really good.  Other buds seem too low in volume.  I never felt like these were coming out of my ear like with other buds...and most importantly the battery lasted through my whole work out.  I had experience with another brand that I had to return because they would die after 45 minutes.  These worked fine the whole time.

Pros: Decently comfortable Cons: Sounds cuts out A LOT. At least 2-3 times per song, the sound will cut out for a few seconds. Really ruins the purpose if you're trying to get into a jogging rhythm etc. They also don't seem to hold a charge very well, so be prepared to bring a bulky charger with you if you plan to use them a few times during the day. I would return mine, but the "return window" was pretty short, so now I'm stuck with them. Not happy.

I've had these headphones for about a month now, and they constantly cut in and out. My phone has some bluetooth issues so I gave them the benefit of the doubt until they started cutting out one at a time. One headset would go out, come back, then the other would do the same. I'd recommend buying another brand. I missed the return window on these by a day, it wasn't even a full month since I ordered them, let alone since they arrived. Terrible product.

UPDATE: After a few months, the left one seems to have a connection issue internally as the sound will cut out if I move the earbud in a certain way. I usually only listen to one side at a time for podcasts and audiobooks, so I will switch to just using the right one now, and will start maybe looking for something that might last a bit longer. ------------------------------------------- I bought these for just keeping handy for doing things around the house, but I've started carrying them with me, and they've come in handy when the stores are already playing INSIPID CHRISTMAS MUSIC already. I like the over-the-ear style. I did not buy them for running, but if my running earbuds fail, I would not hesitate to use these while running, especially seeing as how I can use either of them independently. In fact, that's how I've been using these, mostly, with just one in while listening to podcasts. The sound quality is fine, and no better and no worse than another pair I have (that is not the over-the-ear style and tend to fall out) that cost $80. Some people talk about good or bad "noise cancelation" but people say all kinds of things. No earbuds in this price range are going to offer noise cancelation. As for SOUND ISOLATION, these are just fine, with three sizes of SILICONE (not foam) earpieces. And it looks like it's a pretty standard size hub, so you can probably put earpieces from other earbuds on here if none of the three included make you as happy as a clam. Battery life has been good, and the indicator is a pretty slick feature. I dig it.

My wife and I was so excited when I received the product. But after testing it, the sounds was horrible. The volume from my phone and the product was way up already and you still barely hear the conversation. It could be a factory defect. But I decided to return since not much to troubleshoot..That is why I ordered two at the same day from different company for my wife and for me but unfortunately the other product takes a week than the other.

I am a Dr with extensive head and neck anatomy. This thing is designed for some alien or someone who doesn't want the sound to go into their ear canal. All humans have an ear canal that goes upwards and back. This one is designed so it's pointing down and forward. It is the most improperly designed thing I've ever seen.  Consequently the sound has to be at full volume to hear anything and if you are driving, you can't hear anything.

I have had these a few days now, they are quality ear phones. I have had many types of wireless earphones, all have issues, some are not truly wireless, the wire connecting them to earpieces is always causing problems.. truly wireless earbuds I have tried slip and fall out sooner or later.. Most do not have controls like pause, off, or volume control on the earpiece, requiring one to take the source device out.. to adjust sound or pause These, and are truly wireless. They do not move or fall out, they are completely secure and comfortable on the ear. Each earpiece has all the controls, as you can use them individually. My ears are super sensitive, as is my hearing.  These are comfortable and have 3 sizes of earpieces.  The sound is amazing, crisp, clear, and very good for the price. These are a quality product, and sync together immediately. I have other more expensive earbuds that will not sync together ever, it is very frustrating, since their sound is optimal, I can only use them mono, one at a time.  They  also start slipping fall out after 45 minutes. I have other earphones with a secure over the ear wire, as these do, but the wire always moves and is too long, which hurts and irritates  the back of the ear after 60 minutes.. These are very good so far.. I hope they continue to keep this standard as time goes on.

Just got these and I'm impressed. I spent quite some time researching different wireless headphones and earbuds before I came across these. I love that these are completely wireless but still go over the ear for a more secure fit. They're comfortable for my ears as well which is absolutely fantastic. Other earbuds I've tried (more mainstream brands such as skullcandy and other ones) always fit ok at first but within an hour or sometime less my ears are in pain. The noise reduction is spot on for both ends. I like to play my music loud enough to block out most sounds but usually that means others around me can hear the beat of my music or something of the sort. With these not only do I not need to have the music very loud to cancel out noises going on around me, no one else hears my music! Fantastic! I dont know about any one else but that is something that would drive me insane way too often. Battery life is solid and I like that you can see how much battery life is left for each earbud. Sometimes I like to only have one earbud in so I can have a conversation with someone at the same time while doing a task.

After my iJoy headphones started falling apart during my gym workouts, I decided to try these Occiam Bluetooth Headphones-True Wireless Earbuds. I was a little hesitant to buy these headphones due to some of the other reviews but in my experience, these are really good headphones. They fit around my ears and inside nicely. They connect to my iPhone 6 easily but I did notice that they sometimes tend to pair with my phone while still in their charging case which should keep them "OFF". I also noticed that if I had my iPhone in my pocket while running, the sound cut in and out. Oddly enough, carrying my phone in my hand while running at the same exact speed eliminated the problem. That's not a big deal but just kind of weird to me. All in all, I'd suggest trying these headphones out if you need so nice, inexpensive earbuds you can use while working out, hanging out, or wondering about.

First, I was quite happy with the product. They were generally comfortable and battery life was quite comfortable. My early gripes are just small picky things. The first is requiring the home dock to resync a connection. If I turn off the Bluetooth to share a video or something, I would have to place the headpiece back into the dock to resync and turn it back on. Honestly, not that big of a deal just though I might note it for future purchasers. The second minor gripe is it makes a high pitched ringing while charging sometimes. Again, very minor problem. Now we are just shy of two months and I am down to only one working side. I want to like this product, but the fact that one side has already quit working leaves a bad taste in my mouth.

Well im giving it only 4 stars because even so this earbuds are good what im disappointed üò•.. About is that when I be having both on connected to my Bluetooth on my cell phone the minute I start listening to music it starts to go in and out every time and that's bad especially when they do sound good the base is pretty decent and it's there the battery life is good as well and on phone calls it works awesome and that's where it really bugles me when I use just use one as for phone calls or music it works really well and that is where im disappointed in because the minute I use both that's when it starts to go in and out every time but if I use only one it works good especially on phone calls yeah I could had returned them but since they work really great on phone calls I decided to keep them for only that and I went and got a different pair of earbuds for my music üé∂..... And as for hearing the background as you listening to music it's pretty good but when it comes to really loud sounds like a bus or even a motorcycle you can hear it so im a bit disappointed with this and I wouldn't recommend them to anyone unless I just happen to get a bad batch who knows.

Just got it.  easy to pair, only tested for music, which is my main purpose.  Nice balanced warm sound, bass could be heard at 40Hz at median level.  High frequency is heard up to about15k Hz, stopped suddenly at above frequency.  Tested another earbud, same scenario, sudden sound die-off above 15K Hz.  Perhaps my hearing capability?  Two drives are balanced well.  Listened a few 8D music, very locational.  The hook is soft so there is no stress around the ears, 5 hrs on I didn't feel a thing.  Didn't test for call and waterproof.  BTW, this earbud is the pick after two returns of other brands (not the hook type).  Overall, I do recommend it. Used for 40 days.  Two cons: 1) after the earbud powered off, when turn back on, the connection between the earbud and my PC can not be automatically resumed somehow.  I had to re-initiate by turning the bluetooth off and then on to make the connection. 2) The case is not easy to open because the dent area at the opening spot is too small, thumb is hard to fit int.  quite annoying.  also the two earbud store position in the case, left and right, actually meaning right and left is confusing, not intuitive.  Drop rating from 5 to 4.

Like a lot of folks these days, I have many, many electronic devices - cell phone, Kindles, laptops (yeah, plurals on more than one of those things). I got tired of trying to keep track of my wired headsets, and switched to Bluetooth some time back. I bought two sets of these earbuds, paird one with my Laptop, and the other with my Kindle, since I listen to both music and audiobooks on it. This past weekend, I needed a set of earbuds for another tablet, but didn't want to have to go through the whole pairing process, and instead managed to find an old wired set. That was fine, until I needed to get up and do something, and nearly pulled the tablet off of the desk where I was working. These have good, decent sound (I'm hard of hearing to begin with) and they make a great difference in me being able to hear clearly enough to understand what is being said. I only wish my regular hearing aids worked this well! I just bought two more pair of them for another e-reader (Nook) and that aforementioned tablet (Surface Pro).

I just got this product yesterday. The shipping was great timing. I charged them but they keep saying 78% charged even though I left them 2 hours. I will leave them over night to charge se of that changes. But I did try them. Connected easy to portable MP3 player and sounds great. I said I would buy again but no I wouldn‚Äôt. Sound is great and connect easy to device but don‚Äôt charge completely. Charged overnight and only said 68%. They are comfortable and stay secure.

Just received Occiam headphones.  Packaging was new and as expected.  I just started charging them, so I'll add to this review in a little while after using them.  But so far, so good! **UPDATE** Charge was fast and started using headphones yesterday; and they are really good!  I like them a lot.  A little low on the bass, but the clarity is fantastic.  I have Samsung earbuds, but they don't always stay in when moving around - my ears are small so none of the bud really work.  These stay perfectly over my ear and don't move. The fit is great because you don't feel them after a while.  I'm a developer on the computer all day long.  These headphones work great - especially for the price.  They look good too, because they're vertical, not horizontally sticking out.  Really good design.  For the price these are going to be hard to beat!! **ANOTHER UPDATE** The bass actually is really good now.  I had to adjust my equalizer on Music Bee to 10 band, then added the Pre-Amp!! Now it's excellent.  I'm really impressed.  See ya. *** FINAL UPDATE !!!*** Well... I thought these might work, but today they COMPLETELY STOPPED WORKING!  I've had them for a month or so, but now I'll need to search for another pair.  Based on this I would not buy again! They started going off and disconnecting intermittently, then suddenly totally shut off, even after charging them.

The most comfortable earbuds ever. I mean really really comfortable. Stay in place. That's been a problem for me in past. Sound is great. Would buy again in a heartbeat. ~ 2 mo update UPDATE: I use these daily sound quality is great but the charger case stopped working. It uses a USB to c-charger cord, and it's cheap looking and very short. I didn't have another one to check out if it was a cord or a case problem. I contacted seller by email as outside the return window, but under warranty. They responded promptly and sent an entirely new replacement (earbuds, base and cord, within a week!  While unplugging my old case the cord tip fell apart so that was clearly the problem.  I bought a separate sturdier cord to use moving forward. They should improve the quality of the charger cord, but can't complain given above service.

The reviews on here are surprising. I had this device for a few months. Four issues occurred between the time I brought them up until now. First issue is the design of the charging case. It is very slippery and flimsy. I dropped it once while placing the charger cord in the port. As soon as it hit the ground the lid broke off. Second issue, a month later people were having trouble hearing me through the set (so I can no longer use it for hands free calling). Thirdly, the bluetooth connectivity begin to disconnect without any interference or distance between the earpiece and the phone.  To reconnect it was an ongoing battle of multiple means of troubleshooting the device. Fourth issue, ongoing troubleshooting which involved turning the earpiece off and then back on; returning it to the charging case and then placing it back on my ear; erasing the connection from my phone and then reconnecting. Lastly, the time it takes to connect has increased from a few seconds to two or three minutes. I used this device everyday for answering calls. I wear them when I run twice a week. I listening to music and watching videos with this device. (Things you expect to do with the device) So, my use of this headset is on the heavy side. Heavy use could be the reason for the increasing issues Ive experienced these past few months. On the plus side, The sound quality is still great (on my end) but that may be the next thing to go base on the quility decline of this earpiece. I don't recommend this product for heavy use.

I bought and tried more than 4 wireless earbuds from Amazon. Nothing fits my ears perfectly. All of them fell off while I was on the phone and hurt my ears so much after wearing them more than 1 hour. This is the first time that the earbuds did not fall off. Even I shake head, run, jump...whatever I do, they just fit my ears!!! Not only how it fits but also..... the sound!!! OMG....sooooo gooood! I own Beat headphone and literally, these little ones beat the Beat!!! Bass is good and also a high sound range is good. Call quality is very good, too. My husband could not tell I was talking using the earbuds. He said that it is so clear. I don't use noise-cancelling feature, but I tried. I did not hear my son's playing Minecraft. It was actually great that I don't hear him building blocks' sound lol I definitely recommend to everyone who has difficulty to wear earbuds. Great sound, so comfortable, and in terms of the price, nothing beats these earbuds!!!

I am a painter and I spend at least 8 plus hours with my headphones in, therefore I need something that can hang with my life. I had found a pair that I enjoyed and were much cheaper in price than these, but I decided to venture and try something new. So here I am...writing a review, I normal carry on with life and cut my loses but I felt like sharing my joureny. Got my first pair, had to ask for an exchange. Why? Because the right ear piece kept pushing my ear out and it did not sit well in my ear. Secondly, I sweat a lot because of paint heat (chemicals) and my paint suit, and they kept falling out because of my sweaty ears (my other ones did not fall off as much) and I would have to stop what I am doing to fix my problem, Thridly, because I sweat a lot, the charging three holes on the headphones are now getting oxidize and its not properly charging. Overall, the sound was good but it sucked becasue I always had to keep pushing them in order to block out outside noise. As for the product, I will not buy these ever again. I guess I am the only one with problems since they have "good" ratings.

Well, I finally got tired of wired earbuds especially as I started piling on the winter layers, I tried a few pairs of wireless, one of them was poor sound quality and static so I wasn't too bummed when it easily fell out of my ear for the 30th or so time and got lost, the second sounded ok but also easily fell out. I got these a a backup to try a different brand because I knew the 2nd pair would soon follow the fate of the first. I love the Occiam, the sound quality is exceptional for music and passed my elderly moms hearing issues, they are very comfortable ( so much so that I fell asleep in one once, thought I'd lost another and then found it in my pillows! ) They really hug your ear and I am confident that I will not lose this pair, but if I do I will replace with another of this brand! Highly recommend and great value...

First things first I reviewed this product before purchasing. As I live in the Caribbean and I had it shipped a Florida address for onward shipping to me. I paid 31 + USD for the item and I chose free shipping. I was delivered on time at the Florida address.  However when I finally recieved the product  it came in a box about 12 times the size of the box housing the earphones. I was exicited because my ear pods  would fall out when removing my face mask so I decided to purchase one that has a hook over the ear. The product looked great  but when I put them on the felt good  the problem came when I tried to adjust the volume on the volume button the earphones. It went up but refused to go down again. I tried both sides only the left works. So now I'm stuck with using my phone for adjust the volume up and down. That's disappointing  cause if I'm driving I don't want to be using my phone in my hand. As alaw enforcement official I must set the example.  I contacted Amazon but they said I must return it to ups It has already cost me 31 usd  plus 21usd to ship to the Caribbean and clear customs. A total of 52+ usd. To return from th Caribbean I have to pay and when it return I must clear it again.  I disappointed that I got a broken product and replaced it will cost more than twice the original. Amazon please do better cause we the customers want to continue to do business and not feel cheated out of our hard earned money.

These are awesome! I haven‚Äôt had good luck with ear buds. So I was going to spend more money on a set. Saw all the reviews and decided to give it a try. These work fantastically and they actually stay in place as well. What a great deal, you won‚Äôt be sorry! UPDATE: After using for 4 months and not daily, the left ear unit stopped functioning. It will work occasionally, but then shuts off. Beware! You maybe sorry

These are the most frustrating ear bubs. The first set didn't hold a charge. The replacement ones worked for awhile, then would not connect to my phone. Tried for an hour then gave up. Amazon was also worthless. Made me drive miles to a Kohl's store, spend my own money on gas, and make me risk my safety by going into a store during a pandemic just to return them. I WOULD NOT recommend these unless you want to pull your hair out with frustration. Amazon didn't help either.

I bought these mostly because they have the piece that curves over the back of your ear; I was sick of earbuds that just stuck in & you hoped they never fell out (or you‚Äôre forever adjusting them to stay in). For the price, I‚Äôm really impressed with the quality. The sound is crystal clear & they‚Äôre comfortable enough to wear through an hour-long workout. With other earbuds (specifically noise-canceling ones), I would always be annoyed by that deep thumping noise you‚Äôd hear around them (I‚Äôm sorry I can‚Äôt find a better way to describe this); this was so distracting while I would be in the middle of cardio. These earbuds don‚Äôt seem to have that issue as much. At least, it‚Äôs not enough to bother me anymore. Battery life is great. No complaints there. My only qualm is that you use one earpiece to raise the volume on your device, and the other to lower it. I wish I could just use one or the other to do both. A small inconvenience, but not enough to take away a full star.

Overall, these are nice and have 3 sizes of ear inserts included. They're awkward to put on, but secure. Sound quality: so-so. Cuts out under pressure (e.g. doesn't work well with balaclava/ski mask) Battery life: about the same in use or not (~8 hrs) Case: pocket-safe, but lid pops off easily when open Comfort: you feel them, but not bad for a few hours

Pros: - Stay on ears better than buds without ear hooks. - Easy to connect to phone. - Great battery life. I listen multiple hours per day and really only need to charge the case maybe once per week. - Small enough to carry around easily in a pocket, etc. Cons: - Connection will randomly disconnect briefly while using, so the sound is inconsistent between the ears (and it alternates, so it isn't just one bad bud, it's both and the connectivity). It isn't all the time, it isn't every day or every use, but often enough to be annoying. - Case is a little fragile - broke easily with a small drop so now I have it taped together at the back hinge. - The buds go into the case opposite of the ear they go on - the left ear bud fits into the right side of the case and vice versa - totally an OCD issue, but you do have to cross them when taking them out or putting them back in vs the ear you wear them on. A minor annoyance, but it does irk me a little. :)

Great for the price! I bought these to use when jogging and biking because they are more secure than the standard earbuds. However, the case is made of hard plastic that feels slightly cheap, but not a deal breaker. The blue tooth is easy to pair and ready to use. There are volume controls on each bud to accommodate a left or right handed person which at times can be hit or miss. I prefer using the phone's volume control. *Update 4.30.2021. Neither volume control works any longer. You must use the volume control on your phone which can be a hassle when you‚Äôre riding a bike, etc.  so I am changing 4 stars to 3 When it comes to sound performance,  I would say for the average person, these are ideal. Nice bass! For the sound aficionado, on a scale from 1 to 10, It would be a strong 7 (weak 8) for the lack of true High Definition music resolution. As for call quality, I'd give this a 6+ per several people I spoke to said they could hear an echo when speaking; although I heard them perfectly fine. Overall, I  purchased these for fitness, and not for conversation, so they are perfect for the job, and would definitely recommend!

They are loud enough I can ignore people or just zone out. They don't fall off which was a big thing. I don't like headphones because they either fall out or the big ones hurt my ears. They work with my very picky Bluetooth music player. Also, these bad boys survived an accidental excursion through my washing machine AND dryer. I love these. EDIT 1/10/21: I did notice that a lot of people were commenting on the charging device holding a charge. I will say this is does die after a while--mine in particular, I noticed it does hold a charge up to about 1-2 days before hitting zero if not using it. If use after charging obviously that'll deplete it if I don't charge it again.

If you're looking for decent wireless ear buds on a budget these are a great option.  The sound quality doesn't match say, Bose or Sennheiser, but neither does the price.  They sound good though and are easy to wear.  You won't forget that you're wearing them but you won't be uncomfortable either.  The tips are soft and the ear loop is low profile so you can wear them for extended periods without wanting to rip them out. My husband has a comparable pair of Vislla ear buds at the same price and nearly identical design, also with good sound.  Compared to these, Visllas are heavier on the bass and these Occiams have more emphasis on midrange / vocals (which I like). The case charging display is helpful and the size fits nicely in a pocket.  It's a little odd that when you open the case the right ear bud is on the left and vice versa, but no big deal.  Battery life is great.  I like the separate volume buttons on the top of each ear bud and that either one can be the master.  Pairing is simple and after the initial scan, the process is automatic--it happens when you remove them from the case.

These are the first pair of earbuds (after trying on quite a few) that actually stay on my ear the whole time while running. Most ear hooks I have found, are either way too ridged or like a "wet noodle" as others have said. These are a perfect in-between to me. They even stay on while I take my mask on and off. I have had some trouble with the volume working consistently but the sound quality is great, the range is great, and they are very comfortable. I have had to contact the company and they were quick to respond and very helpful.

The size of the ear phones are great.  I can never get ear buds to stay in so I especially love the added security of over the ear feature.  I just received them so I haven't really got any miles on them but they look like the quality is good.  I will have to leave an update after using them for a period of time.  The earbuds have wireless charging which is a huge added feature. I'm pretty confident I wont lose these bad boys. The only negative I see so far is you have to leave a review in order to claim the free earbuds offered as a prize.  Kinda hard without getting to use these first.  They do look promising though.  Will update if they wind up sucking

I got these earbuds a little while back, and they've been pretty great!  Long battery life, good sound quality, good fit.  But recently I've noticed that the charge on my case has been slowly ticking down.  I have realized that I am unable to charge the case for some reason.  It isn't the wire- I've tried multiple different wires, including the one I use to charge my phone.  All of the wires work fine, but the case does not gain any charge.  It's currently at 18% now, and I'm already starting to mourn this pair- they've been pretty good.  I'm also impressed at how long the case lasted without a charge.  When it finally dies, maybe I'll cut it open to see if there's anything visibly broken on the inside.

I couldn't listen to a whole song without it losing connection. It worked good for a day or 2 but that was it, after that it was useless for me. I put in a review after this happened and I got an email stating that I would be refunded if I took my poor review down. I did and I never received any emails stating a refund was going to be made and never got the refund. $40 dollars isn't a lot of money for ear buds, so I wasn't demanding amazing quality. But at least to be able to connect to my phone and work in close range is the bare minimum so I was unhappy.

I waited a few weeks before writing a review to make sure I used them enough to be able to provide proper feedback. I usually go running for 3-4 hours and at first, I really enjoyed these. Their bass was rich and deep, the audio clarity was pretty good considering the price these cost, everything was good. Then one day, the right side just randomly shut off and wouldn't turn on. I thought it died and just kept running with the left side playing music. After about 45 minutes, the right side powered on and began playing music again. I wrote it off and thought nothing of it. Then I noticed every time I put these headphones in their case that should show the charging levels for each side began to only show the charging level for the left side. Then I noticed that when I put them in the case to charge, the number would decrease daily. So after running, I would put them in the case and it would say 96. The following day it would say 96 as well, I would go running, put them in the case and the following day it would say 92. It's like they weren't being charged properly or the charging display didn't show properly, I can't tell. Then I noticed that the right side would cut off completely when I turned my head to the left sometimes. This reminded me of the older generation bluetooth headphones that used to cut out like this when I turned my head in certain directions. Then today, the left side would cut out and sound like the music was coming from a scratched CD on a CD player. Constantly cutting out and sometimes completely going silent for a while before randomly playing again but still cutting out frequently. Then the right side would do it and they would alternate doing this for hours. I'm done with these, they are absolute junk. This is like the 6th pair of headphones I've gotten from Amazon for under $50 and they all usually don't last more than few weeks or a few months. These only lasted me around 2 weeks which is disappointing to say the least.

So I won't lie, I bought these as a cheap replacement for a pair of headphones that I got as a gift a few years ago. I was thinking 'I'll get something else later, I just need something for now'. So I picked these out and I waited for mine to come in. I was INCREDIBLY surprised. They come in a case that is a little big bigger than the ones I had before. What's nice though is that it feels sturdy and not like it's gonna fly open at the slightest provocation. The display though when I first plugged it in! It is so bright and easy to read and then being able to see what the charge is on either side of my headphones was a friggin dream! It was one of the things I really was going crazy with on my last pair so being able to tell that they were in and charging was a beautiful thing. To pair them to my computer was...really easy and I was surprised by just how simple it was. I've gotten so used to having to fight with my headphones to connect that I forgot it was supposed to be easy. Putting them on was actually very comfortable. I didn't have to switch out the bits to make them fit my ears and they rest really comfortably around my ears themselves. I feel like I can shake and move my head around and they're not going to pop out; this is especially important to me since I'm both clumsy and active. Finally: Do they work well? The sound is impressive for a pair in this price range. They cut outside noise very well; I didn't realize my roommate was talking to me until I turned the sound down almost to nothing. The quality of the sound is actually quite decent; while better can be found in other products, for the price this is above tier. Are they worth the buy? ABSOLUTELY. Right now, the only possible downside has been some of the spelling errors on the packaging and those aren't really a downside but rather amusing. While I need to see how long they last altogether, if they last a decent amount of time with no issue, I might need to rethink my original plan of buying a different set.

First item received was DOA, showed no signs of life when charged for several hours. When I received a replacement it was apparent the first item was not new and had been returned by someone else: shrink wrap missing, wire around charging cable missing, insulator film on earbud contacts missing. My intended use of the earbuds was to replace a set of headphones used by my hard of hearing spouse to watch TV. My current setup includes an Avantree bluetooth transmitter and Avantree headphones. These work well, but the headphones become warm and uncomfortable after an hour or two. The problem with the Occiam earbuds is they introduce a slight delay in the sound. So when the TV speakers are playing (for me) and my spouse is using the earbuds there is a jumbled sound that is not present with the Avantree headphones.

I was never able to get R earbuds to turn on. Ensured proper battery charge twice. Tried turning on using both the auto on feature when removed from case and manual switch. Neither worked. Also, admittedly only one earbud worked (left), but overall tonal quality was mediocre at best . Bass response was sub par even though on line description advertised deep bass response.

I really wanted to like these, but I just can't.  Maybe I received a defective pair, but these are probably the worst Bluetooth earbuds I've ever bought.  The sound cuts off constantly.  I used them on my walks in the morning and about once every 2 mins the sound would just stop for a second or two.  It also stops every single time I turn my head or touch my phone.  They act like they are the plug in earbuds and the plug isn't pushed in all the way.  It is really annoying.  I used them for over a week hoping that maybe it would work itself out, but it hasn't and I don't want to miss my return window.  Sending them back.

I was trying to find a good pair of over the ear loop / sport ear buds.  This set was pretty high on amazon's list and the price is cheap.  I sent them back.  If you have nothing, they're not the worst.  Fit in my ear and felt super secure (and no, not too tight in the ear or uncomfortable or anything).  They do sit pretty deep in your ear though, and that's part of the issue.  Sound is good, comparable to my current JLabs executive whatevers (the sort of step up from the bottom of jlabs earbuds).  The problem is when you need to adjust anything or use the buttons for answering a call or changing music tracks.  The volume rockers being on both ears is nice but seems like a waste of space that other functions could be added to.  They stick out enough that they're easily found and used.  The big beef (and why I ultimately returned them) was the side buttons.  Again, easily found by touch but require some force to press/click which drives the ear buds deeper into your ears and is pretty uncomfortable and not something I wanted to deal with on an ongoing basis.  This is where JLabs (and probably others) win- just light taps on the sides of the earbuds for answering, volume, track changes, equalizer presets, etc.  No excessive pressure.  Add this type of function (and the jlabs app where you get a FULL equalizer to play with!) and you'd have a much more superior product.  I went with the Jlabs sport version and will put them through some testing a write a review for them as well.  Early results though - twice the price (or more) as Occiam here, but just as good as the other jlabs I have with the added ear loops / hooks although they don't feel as secure as the Occiams did, but no amount of shaking my head through them loose or out.  Equalizer in the app was a great addition and wireless charging for the case is good feature as well.

Pairing was easy, sound is amazing, fit is superior to any other headphones I've owned. I've owned earbud style headphones including $200 Bose that are too heavy & fall out, over- the-ear headphones that can get sweaty, around-your-neck styles that fall out or get in the way, and wired ear-hook styles like these (which I think fit best). These offer the best of everything - fit, weight, sound, and let me say this about noise cancelation: even at a moderate volume, I can't hear a word anyone is saying, even right next to me. To say that I'm impressed is an understatement.

Product broke in a week, the company would not replace or refund the money. So I left a bad review then they (three different people) emailed me over and over asking me to remove the comment. So we both agreed on a solution (took 1-2 months long). Then the company never followed through with the solution we both agreed on. Horrible customer service and company, they do not follow through with what they say they will just waste months of your time on a CHEAP QUALITY PRODUCT. SPEND YOUR MONEY AT A COMPANY THAT CARES AND BACKUPS THEIR PRODUCTS!!!

Bit surprised by the 4.5 stars despite how many have rated the product. Product looks great all the way around and certain does what it advertises. Wasn‚Äôt looking to be blown away or am I in any way an audiophile, but it underperforms against my other generic $35-40 wireless ear pod style headphones. Clarity, crispness, bass, and max output is a noticeable drop even for this novices ear. Where it also underperforms is the mic. Called several friends to test it out vs. my older model and each friend says I sound distant or muffled on this one. Can‚Äôt swap older one for this one because of lower quality performance where it matters, despite its convenience and appearance. Probably will just bite the bullet and spring for a quality one. At least those can retain some value and definitely will get the mileage and without thinking if I should upgrade again anytime soon.

I bought these earbuds to replace my broken ones and very happy with these. They fit well and comfortable. Battery life is great. Overall, it's a solid set for the price. Couple possible improvements: I wish they come with additional sizes of the silicone hooks to fit younger people with smaller ears. Also, a clear lid on top would help seeing the charging LED without opening the box.

I really wanted these headphones to work reliably.  My first pair had disconnect issues on the right headphone intermittently, then the case pins broke out for the right headset a week later, making it not able to charge. I got a replacement unit shipped out in three days, and while this one did not "break", I have constant connection loss on only the right headset when my device is only 3 feet away, which was exactly what was happening with the first pair. Unless Occiam can fix their quality control issues, I would say this is not a headset you want to invest in.

I purchased these 6 months ago. I used them mainly for my runs (3-5 miles at a time). I love  that you can see where they are at battery wise. The case has a battery that charges them as soon as you put them away so they should always be charged. However, they automatically turn on when taken out of the case. I found that if the case got bumped and the earphones shifted they automatically turn on and the battery runs out. They also connected easily which is great when trying to get out quickly but awful when you are talking on the phone and the earbuds decided to connect because someone opened the drawer where they are stored. After 4 months they started having challenges getting both earphones to connect at the same time. They are fully charged and are on but only one would connect to the phone. Then the other would connect and disconnect at 5 second intervals. 6 months in and I can't get the left earphone to turn on at all. They just don't last long enough to make them worth the price. The fit was ok, nothing special but not bad either.

My son needed new ear buds and wanted these after reading the reviews and researching different ones. They definitely cancel noise cause he can‚Äôt hear us calling him when he has them in! When he‚Äôs in his moods you can hear the music across the room word for word! Battery life could be better but they last him 48 hrs then he has to charge them now that he‚Äôs back in school and can‚Äôt use them all day. When used all day he has to charge them that night. He‚Äôs very happy with them

I love these.  I listen to audiobooks and videos while keeping house. 1.  You can use these one at a time.  Pair them. Place one back into the charging box.  Enjoy. 2.  The battery is amazing.  Seriously, it‚Äôs amazing.  Using them one at a time I always have it available.  I had to be up for 36 hrs recently.  They were in use the whole time. 3. These will fit securely in your ears even if you have small ears like I do. 4. The range is really good.  Every other Bluetooth headset and earbud I have purchased cut out if I didn‚Äôt carry my iPad into each room with me.  I can now leave it charging and go about my household chores and child chasing. I haven‚Äôt bought anything I loved this much in years. These were originally bought for my husband.  He liked all of these features.  He thought the problem he had with them came from the noise canceling.  He said, ‚ÄúWhenever I took a phone call it always quieted down.‚Äù  So much so, he had a difficult time hearing the call. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs just this set or not.  I don‚Äôt use these for my phone so they‚Äôre still perfect for me.

Over all great bluetooth ear set.  i use them for my workouts, they stay in place for the most part.  changed out the ear inserts to get a tighter fit.  it helped.  but i did notice when i'm sweating like crazy and i move the ear piece, the ear piece will shut off and then say turning on.  so, i've gotten to where i'm wiping sweat off the front of my ears an wiping down the charging connections on the ear pieces.  a small hassle.  if they wouldn't reset, they would be perfect.

1st pair volume buttons didn't work but I loved everything else about these so I returned and got a replacement pair. 2nd pair, Same issues with the volume control not connecting consistently and the bluetooth connection also cut out on this pair sometimes.  Returned them. I really wanted to like these.  Lots of great reviews from others but it didn't work out.  They have great sound quality and great battery life on the buds and the case.  Noise cancelation was good enough for me.  I could still hear my kids enough to know what was happening but it didn't make me loose focus on what I was listening to.  Very comfortable fit, lightweight.

I bought these headphones due to the large number of positive reviews, with that being said unfortunately the highs lasted for a short time. Pros: - mono ability - decent sound quality - digital display of charge case battery levels - comfortable for long wear - stays in place while exercising Cons - low volume, even at max volume these are fairly low. great if you want to protect your ears...but would be nice for them to be louder - case quality feels cheap. Feels as if it would not provide the necessary protection and i suppose this would hold true as detailed below - poor headphone quality. I have had these headphones since Apr 13, 2021 (so nearly 2 months) and the right earbud is already cutting out. There has been moments that a simple touch cause the right bud to distort, this will be accompanied by sudden disconnects where i will have to put the ear piece back into the case. This would help reconnect but the distort on touch still remains to the point i don't even use it anymore. - Case magnet are also fairly week. within the two months of ownership i have noticed the earbuds connecting to my device while in its case. this means the magnet is weak to where even with the case close, they come out slightly and just enough that they turn on and connect, but then the magnet will grab them again thus turning them off. Perhaps I received a bad pair, but i am quite disappointed to have ran into these issues after just 2 months of owner ship.

I've been looking for a headset that replaces my bulky and heavy Plantronics Voyager. It's been quite a search but I think I have the closest one yet. What I really like about this pair is how clear the sound is. Both in the sound that I hear and from the volume of what the person I speaking with is hearing. It does the job and I like it. One thing that I wish the headset will have is slightly more bass and definition but other than that it provides adequate sound and signal. I am completely satisfied.

They offer you a free lifetime warranty or a random new pair of earbuds if you ‚Äúactivate‚Äù the warranty or whatever. When you scan the code, it takes you to a website where you choose your prize and submit your email address. Afterwards, they tell you that in order to obtain the lifetime warranty or free earbuds, you will have to submit a five star review. I am giving them five stars, but only because I want the lifetime warranty.  As for the actual product, the sound quality, Bluetooth pairing and charging are all great. They aren‚Äôt very loud, especially for in ear headphones, and although there is an ear clip, I wouldn‚Äôt wear them for exercise, because they are fairly loose.

Nice noise canceling, solid as a rock Bluetooth, and a really nice carry case.  I also like they way that they feel on my ears, very solid and doesn't move or slip out.  Sound quality leaves something to be desired, although you should keep in mind that is a very personal choice.  For those of you who are in the know, the way I'd describe these is "scooped".  In other words, in a standard EQ range, the mid ranges are de-emphasized for in favor of the low (or sometimes high) ranges so the the EQU range looks like it's been scooped out.  I don't generally have a problem with this for certain kinds of music, but it can get a little annoying at times.  Podcasts/spoken word doesn't need booming bass, and vocal ranges usually live in the center range so you're dulling it.  Most American ears probably won't even notice since everything these days is heavy bass, but it bothers me.  I'm not looking for reference EQ, but the emphasis on the lower ranges is enough to bother me.  Still, I'll keep these.  They're good enough.

At first, I wasn't too impressed with the sound quality, but after some fitment adjustments, the quality is really good. If you don't have a good fit in your ear canal, the bass seems to get lost. This is easily fixed with proper fitment. They connect to each other quickly once removed from the charging case, and will automatically connect to the last device they were connected to.  The charging case is pretty cool, as once you put the headphones into it, they disconnect from your device and start charging automatically. However, I could see this being bad for the battery life if you're only wearing them for a short amount of time and then putting them back into the case. I've gotten into the habit of just turning them off when I'm not using them, and wont put them back into the case until they have reached low battery. One gripe I have is that each ear bud needs to be turned off and on separately. (but this is only if you're not keeping them in the case when not in use, so I kind of understand it)
Batteries die after charging and not in use. I have to charge them immediately prior use every time even though I fully charge them when i'm finished using them

I love these!! The case is sturdy and cute. It shows the percentage digitally so you know how much longer you have.  You can use one or both at a time, the sound is crisp and amazing, bass is pretty great as well. The noise cancelling is seriously great and it charges really well and fast. Also, one of the biggest pluses to me is how fast it connects to the bluetooth in my phone. My old pair had to search and it was odd, but these immediately work. Best purchase I've made in a while! My old earbuds died and I was really upset because they were the only ones I'd ever had that didn't hurt my ears... until these! Yay! They are SO comfy that I forgot they were in when I had the music paused to answer a call at work. And when in, I cant hear any nonsense around me! These things save lives because, lets face it, some coworkers deserve to be punched in the throat for their behavior. Thanks for helping me keep my job and not go to jail. lol :)

The case is slippery but sturdy.  I have dropped it 4 times within a week and it hasn't dented. The product did fall out after pact which made me worry. The ear pieces are more delicate, but seem to be undamaged. They work fine and fit over my ears. The mic is so-so as others have said it is hard to hear me speak. It paired easily and connects each time I take them out of the charging case. Used for 2 hours without issue. Supposed to last 8 hours without charging. To solve the slippery case, I put metallic paint on it to allow for better grip.

I picked these up to use while cutting the grass as standard ear buds tend to fall out when active. The good news is they are very comfortable to wear and gave a nice informative case. The sound is crisp and clean , the bass is below average but the voice clarity at this price is very very good. The bad news for me making them not useful as intended is they are just not load enough to hear while working like cutting grass . Yes trying to push to the limits but if my buds from another brand are loud enough then these should have been too. If your in quiet areas of use then I recommend them. If your not you may struggle

I've had these for less than 24 hours and I'm already in love. They are so comfortable in my ear, I can hardly feel them, and they are so secure. My Beats by Dre headphones were CONSTANTLY falling out of my ears at the gym, but these are completely secure. They paired with my iPhone seamlessly, and switching between using just 1 or both is also seamless. The sound quality is excellent and they block outside noise completely. Minor complaints: 1) they don't get quiet enough. Sitting in my quiet house with the volume on the lowest setting, they're still a bit too loud. What's nice is I can pull them out of my ear but still keep them ON my ear, and then it's not as loud. 2) the play/pause button is a little too difficult to push. Almost hurts your ear when pushing the button. 3) my wife thinks they look very goofy on me, though she thinks most ear buds look goofy. You look at the pics and judge for yourself.

I love my AirPods, but they aren't quite secure enough to stay in my ears while on my runs, requiring me to keep re-seating them back in my ears every 5 minutes or so.  So I was looking for a pair that would be more secure while working out, but not break the bank, and providing some of the conveniences of my AirPods.  These seem to be an excellent value and meet my needs.  The ear hooks keep them seated correctly while I run (6-8miles), the battery is perfect for my use, and I love the charging case has battery and charging indicators.  Sound quality is good, not great, but given the cost, it should meet your expectations.  Very happy with these headphones!

Update- I accidentally put these through the washing machine twice. I washed my clothes and did not remove them from the wash. The next evening, they had a bit of a funky smell, so I put em through again. Well, the individual head phone (I only listen to one at a time) made it through two washes!! It still works!!! I love these things!! Previous review: I love these head phones. I hike or do some sort of PT everyday, and use these while I do so. They stay in my ear while I am running or taking a sweatshirt off- they stay in my ear, which is why got them. I can stand it when they fall out, or when I have to continually have to readjust them- I don‚Äôt have to do that with these. Additionally, they do not hurt my ear after wearing them for many hours. Oh, which reminds me- the battery life is great. I go out hiking for 4 maybe 4 1/2 hours. They always last the entire hike, just as long as I charge them after each use. I do have to recharge them every night, they do not hold a charge otherwise. All in all, these have been my favorite earbuds.

These wireless earbuds surpassed my expectations. Fantastic sound quality and the battery life is more than I‚Äôll ever need for any runs or hikes. The reserve battery in the case is a great feature when you‚Äôre not able to recharge right away, giving even more playtime to the buds. I‚Äôve always had problems with earbuds fitting in my ears, but these fit like a glove! It even comes with different heads in case your ears are bigger or smaller than the heads it comes with. The removable heads also make for easy cleaning. The arms are solid enough to provide support without being painful to wear for extended periods of time, and I‚Äôve never had the buds fall out of my ears. Although they don‚Äôt provide a seal or active noise cancelling, when they‚Äôre in your ears and music is on, you won‚Äôt be able to hear anything going on around you. My only complaint would be that the buds and case appear to be a bit lightweight and don‚Äôt seem very heavy-duty, but as long as I don‚Äôt throw them around I have no concerns beyond that.

I really wanted to love these because of the price and reviews and they sounded really good but they were just not comfortable for my ears. I do have smaller ears so even AirPods are not the most comfy but I tried all three ear bud cushions and after a few minutes my ears were just hurting and I tried for over an hour but I would just be having to take out after a couple minutes. The sound is really great so if you are willing to try the comfort of them on your ears I would say the price and quality is worth it if they are comfortable for you.

OVERVIEW: This pair works well for times when I don't want to use my nicer earbuds. FIT: They stay well while running and working out, thanks to the over-ear hook. SOUND: The sound quality isn't anything remarkable, better than the $20 pair I got but more muted than my $60 pair of Taotronics. Unfortunately it does make a popping sound sometimes when I'm running, like there's a plastic diaphragm in the bud that has unbalanced pressure. There isn't any active noise cancelation, just the passive reduction from having the buds in your ears. CONNECTION: The Bluetooth connection isn't the best with distance or with sudden changes in direction, like when I turn my head too fast it will drop out momentarily. BATTERY: The one part that is pretty slick is that the case has a display that will give you the charge remaining in the case, as well as show you how it's charging each of the buds. The case can recharge the buds quite a few times before running out, tho it is a bit beefy. CONTOLS: For some reason the controls on the buds don't work with my Galaxy S8. Not sure what the issue is there, but it's mildly annoying.

Headphones were given as gifts.  My boys like the sound and performance of the headphones.  The charging pod is very handy, when on the go.  One big issue.  The battery, in the charging pod, is soldered directly to the PC board of the charging circuit.  There is not much impact protection at all.  Both of them have dropped the charging pod.  In both cases, this has caused the batter tab to brake off.  There was no repairing this brake.  Already replaced the Li-Po battery in one of them.  Working on replacing the other.  Be very careful with the charging pods.  They will not withstand a decent drop.  The battery should have better impact protection, or a LiPo battery should be connected to the pc board with wires instead.

These are great for working out! *they were great until last week. Barely lasted 2 months before refusing to charge. Only 1 side charged after the first month but I only used them for walking around the neighborhood. (walking out) so I figured I could deal with just 1 ear. Then the second side of the case stopped charging not soon after.

Stay on and sound great. Awesome! They work great. All functions work and they are easy to use. Play, forwarding, reject/answering calls. Volume is very important and works like magic. Would highly recommend and got my girlfriend a pair. Battery life is very good. Great warranty and customer service. Would totally buy more. Hard to get any better than what they delivered on time and was very quickly. Charges very easily and quickly. Great hard case and comes with accessories and extra earbuds that work really well. Great purchase. Everyone should really try these out since it is such a good product. Waterproof and they stay on no matter what I am doing outside in the sunshine. My girlfriend was so very happy with the gift purchase and talks about them everyday specifically the warranty, the great accessories, the so very perfect functionalities.
