On off forwarding answering volume and etc. Please buy them and you will be sold and happier than you have ever been. They are so very awesome and successful. I would've bought more if I had more family members whom would sincerely appreciate them for a lot of very good reasons. The noise cancellation feature is number one compared two the five other pairs i have recently tried. Solid product for over one hundred reasons. I am so glad i purchased these fabulous headphones multiple times as they are the perfect pair of headphones bar none. Everyone should go online to Amazon and purchase these over the top bad boys. Great item!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Sound quality is decent.  Not great, but far from mediocre. Unfortunately, these are useless for ANDROID devices.  As others state, you lose volume control.  You can only adjust via the phone, and that makes these earbuds worthless.  The manufacturer's BS about the difficulty of making them work with both Android and iOS is hogwash.  All the other manufacturers have figured it out, why can't they? Because Android was an afterthought for these earbuds.  Dont waste your time and money on these if you own an Android.

Update: I've had these for a while now and I use them pretty much exclusively with my airpods being the backup pair. Still loving the sound quality and the fact that they are pretty secure during workouts... However, I'm dropping a star because the lid off the case broke and I suspect there pin snapped and got stuck inside the case and may be interfering sightly with the electronics because now it makes a soft but nonetheless high pitched squeal when it charges. Annoying but tolerable, and at least it isn't a persistent squeal. Original: I got these as a backup for when my airpods needed charging, but it turns out I prefer them. They stay in and they're better at noise cancelling. I like the fact that the charging pod tells you what percent battery it has. Sometimes there's a little connectivity issue, which is why I can't 5 star it, but I've had the same types of connectivity issues with the airpods, too, and these were much less expensive, so I can't complain too much about it.

iPod style headsets do not fit me, ever. These are super lightweight and very secure with the adjustable ear wrap. I sometimes forget I‚Äôm wearing them. They‚Äôre easy to pair up with your device and once paired, will automatically pair with that device by default. Sound quality is excellent for phone calls. No extraneous static. Callers never know I‚Äôm on a headset. Music sounds very good. With a full charge, I can listen continuously 12-15 hours. A brief top off from the charging case and I can go round the clock.  Charging is fast and easy.  Controls are reliable and simple to memorize. You can pause, play, adjust volume, advance to next track or go back to the previous. The only thing you can‚Äôt do is fast forward or rewind within a track. For the price, these headsets rival much more expensive ones. An amazing value. Would definitely recommend.

First pair received did not work Second pair works fine but occasionally the left and right don't stay paired They will not last half the day even when only talking for a few hours. Lastly-5 star review required for a warranty. look at the 5 stars. less than a full concise sentence due to just a few character requirement for the review process. how does amazon not stop this garbage?

I returned the item as I could not get it to charge - I went on their web site and followed their instructions for a non charging device but to no avail. Looked like a nice set, but if I cant get it started now, not sure I want to try it again.

First earbuds I've ever owned and I am very pleased with them.  Connected easily to Bluetooth on my Moto G5 Plus.  Easy to operate controls.  Good sound for listening to music from my cell phone app.  They fit comfortably and securely.  Received a phone call while listening to music.  Clicked the MFB once and had a very clear connection.  Asked caller how my voice was coming through and was told it was perfectly clear.  The max volume is loud and distortion free (had to test it, but not for long to avoid hearing damage).  Occiam also has a great Lifetime Warranty offer.  So far, so great! 5/27/21 Update: The USB port became misaligned and the charging cable would not stay securely inserted.  Notified Occiam of the problem and just wanted the charging case replaced.  They sent me a replacement with everything included.  Couldn't be a happier customer with this company and their prompt service.

For a near 40$ earbuds, the designs, boxing and engineering are all poor. 1) You can see in the pictures, that they have their orientations wrong with the right earbuds being place to the left, and vice-versa. 2) The box that it came in had TONS of spelling and grammatical errors. Definitely a foreshadow for how poorly they pay attention to details. 3) The earbuds are connected as two seperate bluetooth device but they often have syncing problems. One earbud would play a delayed audio while the other plays normally, causing you to hear two different things. 4) Theres no touch features for skipping or replaying a song like most earbuds have. 5) Sometimes the volume up/down button works, sometimes it doesn't. 6) After a month, the earbuds will randomly connect to your phone even in its charging case. 7) After two months, the charging case stop working and now the earbuds are out of battery and they stopped working.

I have been buying alot of earbuds. I have a big family and every one wants something different.  But these do it all. Great sound and low price. Most of the buds I have bought have less then Great stable connection. Most the time they work well but drop out occasionally. These haven't dropped out once. Another thing is most are ok but when making a call they have issues. These seem great. I sound clear and can hear with no issues.  I even wear them while vacuuming and I still hear well. They stay on my ear even during walks. Oh and unlike most they have an up and down volume so no accidentally turning it up trying to turn down. All In all they are well rounded and don't seem to have downsides. I would recommend these to anyone needing ear buds. The only thing I would change is to have a bigger battery and port to use to charge my phone like some other brands but would get again either way.

I have gone through  a good half dozen wireless earbuds. While the sound is off one will fall out of my ear and get lost. That will not be the case with these. The sound is crisp and clear with good base. Of course I have only had these for one day. I especially love the lighted number tell me how much charge in the box. and the lighted scale telling me how much charge is in the earbuds. The hooks for the ears will be a master stroke for very active people like me. This is an addendum 1 week later. These are so conformable I forgot to remove them when I went to bed. Woke the next morning and had a shower. Later found my earbud in the shower. Stayed in my ear all night and only fell out while I was taking a shower. After drying it off with a towel I set it aside, not in the charger for few hours and then charged it and it worked just fine. I am going to buy another set so when I finally find a way to break or lose these I will have a back up.

These are exactly what I needed! They work amazingly well. Paired super easily. Wrap around my ear comfortably with the confidence of them staying put. I bought these for a few purposes. 1. I needed something to sleep with. I have a kitten. Who loves to attack and chew on wires of earbuds, including while I'm asleep or forget them in bed. Fast forward to giving these a shot. And they're amazing... Battery life is great. Sounds great. And noise cancelling. Meditation and sleeping with affirmations has never been so peaceful! 2. Working out. Gardening. Outdoor activities of all kinds. Works great! Don't worry much about knocking them off. 3. Putting them in simply to drown out noise when shopping or other loud locations where I don't have noise level control.

Great sound, charge lasts about a whole day if you use it a lot. Very convenient to be able to charge on the go. I like that they go over my ear so I don‚Äôt drops them when working out. They‚Äôre also water resistant, I used them in rain and at the gym. Lifetime guarantee, fantastic costumer service. I emailed them long after I ordered them when they suddenly stopped charging and Amazon return was way past the 30days. They responded very quickly and sent me a brand new set for free! Very impressed!

bought these to use with my metal detector. they link up quickly and easily. i have used them for hours and they barely use battery. they fit my ears comfortably and after of hours of use they remain so. i have the volume turned down very low as they will blow your head off at up around max i would imagine. the little charging case is great as well and if you dont put it in a pants pocket it should be sturdy enough to last a long time, just be aware of the case and be gently with it. it could stand to be sturdy enough to carry it in jeans etc, but alas it is not. that notwithstanding i would highly recommend this product to anyone needed such devices

What's not to like about these amazing headphones? When I purchased them, they were on sale for a steal - hopefully anyone reading this will be as lucky. As for the headphones themselves, they came in very minimal packaging (which I appreciated). Everything was packed away neatly in a small box - the headphones, rubber tips for size adjustment, charging case, USB charger cord, and easy-to-follow instructions. I read the instructions and took the advice to charge the earbuds / their case before the first use, but they were already charged! How convenient is that? The headphones fit comfortably around my ears and don't budge as I work out in various ways (stationary bike, calisthenics, something akin to dancing, bendy yoga poses, etc). Their sound is *amazing* I get great audio quality, volume, and bass in particular. Their battery life is great - I haven't had them die on me yet. Being consistent with keeping the charging case charged helps immensely with this. It isn't difficult to do and worth having fully charged headphones each time I go to use them. When I ran into a minor issue (regarding a surprise that came along with my order), customer service was efficient and receptive, working urgently to leave me very satisfied. All told, this is definitely a brand I trust and would love to order more electronics from in the future - get you a pair!

Unfortunately, even for the price, theses earbuds are not a ‚Äúgood‚Äù value as others have said.  A good value implies that the earbuds function as described.  There‚Äôs a barely legible section in the description that refers to ‚Äúvolume‚Äù issues but mainly focuses on Android.  Bottom line: the earbuds + and - buttons which are supposed to change the volume on your iPhone do not function.  I tested this extensively when I received my first set and the buttons didn‚Äôt function regardless of the platform (YouTube, Spotify, Music App, Podcasts, Netflix...etc.).  I tried restarting the phone and then unpairing and repairing the earbuds but the effort was futile.  The volume of source did change when I changed the volume on the iPhone itself but the buds would not impact volume.  Other functions did work on the buds themselves (on/off, Siri...etc.). I contacted support who responded in 24 hours and after a few questions quickly processed and sent me a replacement.  It took about 3-4 days.  I received the replacement today and believe it or not, the new set has the exact same problem.  I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs and iPhone issue (I‚Äôm using an iPhone 12Pro) or the IOS (14.4.2) but either way, the product for my use is a failure without the ability to use the volume buttons on the buds themselves. Customer service should receive a high review for the quick response but if two of the exact product have the same functional issue, there is a hardware/software problem that TY needs to fix or inform users prior to purchase.

So far these headphones have been great. They fit the ear well and are very comfortable. I love the different sizes of ear pads so they can fit inside the ear more comfortably for the wearer. The charger and amount of time to charge is very reasonable. Most people have computers or a wall plug that has plugs for USB cables. Plus I like the display for just where you are on the charge. That way you don't get caught in the middle of listening and lose the sound because your earphones just died. lol! Being able to charge the case or put the headphones in the case to charge along with the case is handy too. Especially if your out and about and need a charge.  It's case it small and will fit in a pocket or a bag of some kind easily. You wouldn't really notice it was there really.

Sound quality ok. Volume is pretty good, loud enough for a shop environment, but begins to distort at the max volume. Power cuts off intermittently in right earbud - this might be a fluke issue which doesn't occur on EVERY set, but I'm probably not the only person this has happened to. If you leave earbuds in case, they continue to drain battery of case even after buds are at 100%. If you leave case plugged in to charger, it does NOT prevent overcharging and battery issues begin to show (shorter supply at 100%, etc).

Revised....these have really great sound, are easy to pair, live the charging case.  The only thing is they disconnect a lot.  If I'm out running for an hour, they will lose connection at least 5 times.  1 of them even cut power completely but turned itself back on after about 5 minutes.  Do I still love them?  Not so much.  I wish they were more reliable. Original review....I'm one of the suckers who believe I have to have the more expensive earbuds for good quality.  My earbuds stopped working after a few years and I learned of these from the Women's Peloton NPR facebook group.  I figured since I can easily return them, why not just try them.  OMG...these are really good!  They feel light and comfortable, easily pair, and then sound is crazy clear!  Thank you Occiam!

Update 7/11/2021: Just purchased my 2nd pair of these due to misplacing my first pair. My original review still stands and will add the life of these headphones is AMAZING! I only have to charge the base once a week. I wear the headphones all day as I link them to my work laptop for my phone. For work purposes, no feedback on video calls, still clean sound both ways. Then on the weekends I listen to music all day without a hitch! These are hands down the best ever! Love how the case displays both the charge left on the case and on each headphone. The sound is crisp, clear, and good base! They fit comfortably and very ease to pair with my devices. The noise cancellation is excellent even with the volume not turned up very loud. Excellent product, great quality, and one of the best bluetooth headphones I've had in a long time. Highly recommend. (I was not paid for this review.)

This is my initial review of the ‚ÄúWireless Earbuds Occiam Bluetooth Headphones 48H‚Äù which I have had for a week.  I will update this review after using the earbuds over time.  The Occiam earbuds came in a nice box without excess packaging. The charging case is well designed of high quality materials. The charging case and earbuds were nearly at a 100% charge and I plugged in the case to get both to a full charge.  The USB cable could be a little longer (it‚Äôs 12 inches) but worked fine. It was very easy to pair the earbuds with my iPhone and the sound quality is quite good for the price.  I didn‚Äôt notice much noise cancelling during my initial use. The product comes with 3 different sized tips.  I like the ear hooks, which are comfortable and provide additional protection against the earbuds falling out.  I have had issues with previous earbuds not fitting securely in my ear, that is why I like the hooks, which are not that noticeable. I am pleased with this purchase!

These were surprisingly decent for the price. I got these as a replacement for a set I lost (JBL Endurance Peak) and figured at this point the technology is refined enough to warrant solid cheaper products and got a bit of an upgrade actually at a much lower price. The BT is pretty good, and doesn‚Äôt cut out like my JBLs did from a moderate distance through walls (leaving my phone on my desk to use the bathroom, etc.). The earbuds have independent functionality and the fit works for me personally. It has a fuller sound as well, and without being an audiophile about it (because consider the context) I can say it‚Äôs pretty good if you have standard expectations. I have some criticisms like needing to push the outer button into your ear to play/pause (not a fun experience and awkward while running ‚Äì a button on the bottom would be more accessible), but my touch controls got annoying while wet on my former set so you win some, lose some. It also doesn‚Äôt automatically turn off when you take them off (no sensors for it) but my former set was annoying about turning off completely so it‚Äôs an adjustment. Overall, a good product for the very low price and I‚Äôm pretty happy with what it does as someone who wears it to do some work at my desk and also while running and working out. Fit was really the priority for me and it meets that criteria perfectly. I'm giving 5 stars because while it's not perfect, I think it's a good buy and there aren't that many options out there that have a secure fit for active use without compromising on battery, sound, etc.

I absolutely love these. They stay on well with the ear loop and the ear pieces are the most comfortably fitting I‚Äôve ever had. The battery life of the charging case is OUTSTANDING! I listen to mine approx 8 hours straight and put back in case to charge overnight. I literally did not need to recharge the charging case for 3 weeks! Others I had to charge daily or every other day. Sound quality is excellent. I also love that when removing it from the case it automatically connects to bluetooth so I don‚Äôt have to go into settings every time I use them and love that I can use one at a time, even if one were to be lost or damaged, the other would still function. The size of the case is a bit larger because of the ear loop, but I actually prefer it over the tiny cases. I have nothing negative to say.

Updated: You do get what you pay for. This is cheap. I can hear fine when it work but there's no bass. Like others that complained, the Bluetooth goes in and out a couple of times when I'm watching a movie. It made the movie unwatchable. Majority of the time the connection is fine. I later found out that I was getting a bunch of other notifications from email, SMS, and etc. that was tripping the sound. There is no noise cancellation at all. I could hear everything around me while using it but I could also hear what I'm listening to. It is like the sound was enhanced without raising the volume. I guess that's what passive noise cancellation means. When on the phone call, I was told that my voice was extremely hard to hear and was recommended to return it. It enhanced the background noise versus reducing the background noise and enhancing my voice. The case is neat. The charge indicators for the case and for each ear piece is helpful to know when to charge the case and the ear pieces. It didn't bother me that it didn't support wireless charging. I have noticed that at times I have to wiggle the ear pieces to make sure that the connection touched to charge. The case is a bit thick which makes it hard for me keep in my jean pockets so I don't carry it everywhere. The placement of the ear piece is on the opposite side, meaning the left piece is on the right side and the right piece is on the left side. Not an issue but some getting use to. Lastly, at times, it was hard to tell which side the case opens.

I have tried at least a dozen different types of wireless earbuds over the past few years in a desperate attempt to find some that don't hurt my ears after 30 minutes.  I can truly say that these are the first ones that don't bother me at all.  I put the smallest earbuds on them and because they go over my ear, the weight isn't constantly pressing on my inner ear. The sound is great - crisp and clear. They auto pair no problem (I've had other headphones that are a nightmare to pair, so this was very nice.) The battery life is amazing, and you can recharge them several times from the case.  Plus, there's a digital charge meter so you can see when you need to recharge the case. All in all, I am super happy with these earbuds, and would highly recommend them - especially considering how comfortable they are and the great price!

The LED display about battery life is in theory a great idea, but it's terribly inaccurate. For some reason the headphones sit in the case backwards - the right headphone is on the left, and the left headphone is on the right.  Inevitably, because the case is a flimsy piece of plastic, the headphones don't sit tight in the case and the charging contacts sometimes get knocked around. So you might wind up with one headphone fully charged and the other completely not charged if you accidentally move or touch the case (while closed) when it is trying to charge. Sound quality is tinny but pairing was at least relatively straightforward to my Amazon Fire Stick. I would have returned these headphones but forgot to do it within the Amazon return window.

I wanted to like these ear buds so much. I like how they fit on my ear, you get three sizes for the rubber ear thingies for them and I used the smallest one provided. They were easy and comfortable to wear. Charging case is awesome. The only problem is, I'm a sweater when I work out. Because of this, the charging metals on the right ear bud RUSTED from my salty sweat and no longer charge in the charging case. That's right... I rusted the freaking earbud because I sweat too much when working out. The range it has for blue tooth capability isn't as good as Beats or Bose (but these are way cheaper, so expected). So if you sweat a lot from your head/face, I recommend investing in ear buds that are meant for that level.

I use these for work daily (10+ calls per day) and love them!  Easy to pair, battery life is decent, but between calls I will just pop them in the case since it charges the headphones several times on a single charge. I have used them on a couple runs and they were comfortable with great sound for music.  I didn't have to adjust them even with bouncing.  Highly recommended!

I needed ear buds with the loops around my ears because I use them on my motorcycle and need to make sure they will not be blown out of my ears at speed.  These earbuds explain themselves right out of the box.  I  paired quickly them to my iTouch which I use for workouts (because I leave my phone in my locker to minimize distractions) and to my phone for non-workout uses and the music was very clear.  The bass isn't the greatest but, overall, the sound is very good, especially for the price.  It was a bit of a trial to change the ear tips but nothing that a little mechanical ingenuity couldn't resolve.  Overall, very happy and looking forward to megabuck Apple features and happy motoring at a much lower price.

Excellent Bluetooth earbuds with microphone so you can talk on the phone while you‚Äôre driving or your kids can listen to their music while they‚Äôre in the car with you so you do not have to listen to their music very nice quality got nice bass and sound my kids absolutely love them highly recommended

Updated Review: These headphones have been great. I use them to work out and to watch videos on my phone and tablet. They are comfortable, stay in while working out and being active, and the sound is great. I typically only use them at about 1/3-1/2 volume, so they should be plenty loud for most people. The sound quality is sharp and crisp with good bass. Good battery life, I just put them in their case whenever I'm not using them and they're always good to go when I want them. I charge the case 1-2 times per week as needed. I had an issue when the case to my first pair stopped charging via the cable. I tried other cables and couldn't get the case to charge, so I ended up having to send them back. Amazon immediately replaced the headphones for me and the replacements have been working great. Things happen occasionally with any electronics. What matters is how the company responds. Not only did Amazon have my replacements delivered the next day, but the seller reached out to me to ensure that I had been taken care of and was satisfied. I would definitely recommend these headphones to any of my friends or family. Original Review: Stopped working after 2 months of light use. Never dropped, no water damage or anything like that. Just using them a couple of times per week while working out or to listen to music or videos on my phone. The case refuses to charge, have tried 4 different cables. Nothing. The headphones charge via the case, so the whole system is broken. Requested a replacement from Amazon as it was still within return period. We‚Äôll see how those ones are.

Best $32 I've ever spent. For the money the sound is great! Are they bose earphones? No. But did I wear these comfortably in the airport, on the plane, in the car, around the house with great sound? Yes. The battery life is great too. And I don't know about other people's phones but on my Galaxy when I connect to the blurtooth it tells me how much battery life is left on them, which is nice. I also work out in these and have no issues. I originally bought another pair of OCC's thst you just put into your ear (no wrap around ear pieces) and I didn't like those. They felt like there were gonna fall out. But not these! Much better! Would 100% recommend and even give as a gift to someone!

I needed earbuds that would stay in my ears during fast spins and twizzles and also allow me to leave my phone at the wall of the rink. This set does that. I need to say that I am not able to tell you if the sound quality is that of a pair of Beats, per se, since I have no real experience here. But for my needs, the distance is about 185 feet from the wall to the end of the arena and the broadcast not only reaches, it never skips out if I face the other direction which happened with older Bluetooth hookups, so annoying. They are comfortable and the volume controls work well. The sound quality is great for my uses.  The battery life of the case is great and allows me to only need to recharge once a week. I'm happy I bought these, they are performing as I needed and hoped.

This is it, guys!! It was a bit of a trial and error journey trying to find the right wireless Bluetooth earbuds. I had to return my previous Bluetooth wireless earbuds before finally landing on these. First, the Boltune Bluetooth V5.2, because they were too big of a fit for my small ears. And secondly, I returned the HolyHigh Pro Bluetooth 5.0. Although the quality was decent and they were comfortable to wear, they wouldn't charge properly AT ALL, which unfortunately defeated the whole purpose and experience. THEN it came down to this, the Occiam Bluetooth - very reliable for the past several weeks! Haven't had a single problem with charging it, and it charges fast! The sound quality is OK. Wasn't expecting it to be beyond just OK - just needed it to sound decent enough when listening to YouTube/music when walking outside. Also, love the easy-to-read digital number screen that tells you the battery life - takes the guesswork out for sure. Highly recommended!

So yet another poor quality Chinese product being sold on Amazon. How original. Don't let the positive reviews fool you. It's another company that will give you either a lifetime warranty or a second set of earbuds for free if you review their product. And no doubt they will e-mail you if you leave a negative review saying, "give us another chance." The earbuds don't pair left-to-right automatically. You have to turn on each ear. On top of that, you have to turn each one off manually. Lastly, the buttons are way too hard to press (especially on your ear) to change the track on your phone. I'm just tired of garbage products on Amazon being given "5 stars."

Wanted a set of earbuds that had decent quality to use when cycling, but they needed to be a good value in case they fell out and got lost on the trail.  Willing to sacrifice a bit of quality to meet those needs.  These earbuds were just what I needed and more.  The around the ear design makes them virtually impossible to lose.  The sound quality and volume is great when using both buds together.  When on a road as opposed to a trail, I only use one so that I can hear vehicles with my other ear.  You do lose quite a bit of both quality and  volume when using only one, but I would think this is to be expected.  The nice thing is that they operate alone seamlessly.  And having all controls on both earbuds is a great feature.  The digital charge display on the case is a really nice feature that eliminates the guesswork of when to charge them for my next ride(s).  Battery life seems excellent.  Single ear bud only lost 10% for just under an hour of use.  On top of all of that, they warranty them for LIFE!  Even if you lose them!!!  Who does that?  Occiam now has a lifetime warranty on me as a customer!  I will look for their products first before considering any others.

BT connection is awesome, take out of case and they connect before I can get them on. Decent sound quality with better (not great) but better bass than last ones I purchased. The only con is a big one. I had read reviews indicating trouble with earbuds turning off sporadically.  Not true under normal circumstances. However, once I started sweating during a workout, nearly everytime I wipe my forehead with a rag just getting close to the earbud causes it to cut off. Then a few seconds later it turns itself back on. My wife borrowed them a couple times for the gym and she had same complaint. Kind of a big deal to me and obviously not an isolated issue. Very annoying. I submitted a quick and favorable review just after receiving earbuds. This is an updated review. Would not recommend.

I pick berries in the summer and like to listen to music when I'm in the woods.  The wires on wired ear buds kept catching on things and wireless ear buds that just stick in your ears kept falling out.  I've now used these twice and both times they stayed on perfectly, the sound is great and are very comfortable.  Only down to 85% on the batteries after using them for over 4 hours.

All around these are some seriously excellent headphones for the price. The charging case is lovely, it's all a fairly small package, everything fits nicely together, and the displays are clear and easy to read. The earbuds themselves are nice, fitting snugly in place without feeling tight or in the way. The sound quality is great, as good as any headphones I've personally tried, and the controls directly on them are pretty solid too. The battery life seems good, so far I've only worn them for a few hours at a time, about five at the most, and have not run into any issues there. Between the headphone battery and the case they definitely live up to the claim of a long battery life, and even with using them every day since they arrived, about four days overall, the case batter never went south of sixty percent, so for your casual every day use I'd say these are a great pick up, well worth the money. Easy to use, easy to set up, and functional all around, I definitely recommend.

As you can see the part that goes around your ear has broken.  It just snapped in two Also the noise canceling is non-existent. Everyone complains about the background noise  You can't walk outside, drive, wash dishes or anything else. Battery life of the headphones is good. The charging case works well and it holds a charge for a long time. ***UPDATE*** The top has broken away from the case. The pin came out. Now to see about replacing since they broke.

These work great.  They are very comfortable, the sound quality is good, and the charging case is nice.  I have many other BT headphones but they are attached by a wire to each other.  These are great without that wire especially when working out - gives you complete freedom and no more wire sticking to your neck.  I would highly recommend buying these.

Downgrading my review to 1 star since one of them already stopped working. All of the sudden the right one sounds started cutting in and out or not working at all  sometimes wiggling makes it work for a few minutes. It's not a charging issue. I mainly use these for listening to audio books and occasionally while watching video content. The sound quality is fine for this purpose and the ear buds stay in place even when doing yard work/weeding, exercising etc. They are pretty comfortable. I usually use only one at a time so I can be listening to what's going on around me as needed and switch from one ear to the other every couple hours. Battery life seems good and the charging case works well. I would buy them again.

These Bluetooth headphones are exactly what I have been looking for.  They are lightweight, great sound quality and very comfortable.  After putting them in, I literally forgot they were there.  Even with phone calls, it feels like I have all the privacy i need because of the noise canceling feature.  I get about 20ft distance from my phone to the headphones.  For the price these are awesome! Updated Review:  So Ive had these headphones for 3 months now, and from the beginning, I noticed that it would continue to charge non-stop and drain the charger unless I kept the right earbud out of the case.  It would charge the left earbud to full capacity, then turn it off, but soon as I put the right one in, it would charge and leave it on, so the right would continue attempting to connect to my phone, draining itself, causing it to charge from the case until the case ran out of stored charge.  Now, today, all of a sudden, the right earbud started loosing sound, fading in and out and finally just would not play any sound.  I turned it off, charged it and attempted to have it connect again, and same thing, faded out immediately and no sound.  Not too happy with it right now.

Not sure what the poor reviews are all about but I have had ZERO problems in the almost year I've had mine. Sound quality is about an 8.5 ( they compare to my Beats 4s) but connectivity and battery life has been an A++. They claim 48 hours of playback I've been getting 100 hours battery life on the recharging case and never fail to connect to my Note 10+ immediately. They are certainly more comfortable than my Beats, connect quicker and more reliably. All in all they are my daily drivers. For the money you just can't beat them. One thing however is the lid to the case wants to fall off. But thats the only negative I've got.

These arrived very nicely packed with clear instructions, a USB-C charging cable, and extra-sized buds.  The pairing was super simple, just charge them up to 100% and remove either the left or right earpiece and it automatically begins pairing. I like to lay in bed watching videos and in an effort not to disturb those around me, I wear these in bed.  The sound is crystal clear.  No muffling of noises, no static, crystal clear, and oh my goodness, the bass is punchy and powerful.  I am loving the battery case and the only thing I wished was that the charging was wireless but it's no biggie. I couldn't be happier.. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to leave me a message.

This is my fourth attempt at bluetooth earpieces that I can connect to my phone, use during phone calls and wear on walks without them falling out of my ears.  These were heaven!!!!  The ear band is very soft and flexible, not hard rubber/plastic like the others, so you hardly know that they are on your ears.  They fit very well the first time.  My friends tell me that the sound quality during phone calls is very good - they cannot tell that i am on a bluetooth connection. My only qualm is that they do go into standby mode and you have to wake each side up.  I haven't fully tested the battery power, but love the case that displays the remaining battery charge.

The earbuds are very well made, it charges super quick and don't fall off of my ear like other similar earbuds. Revised: Product arrived with broken lid as you can see the first picture. I reported to Amazon and got a replacement, as I waited for replacement i tested the earphones which is why I had said above review. The second one arrived and it does not have the little metal rod that keeps the lid attached. They keep sending me broken product and replacements and just wasting my time. I'm returning both and will try to get full refund because I'm sure case is gonna be damaged and not charge properly if it can't close properly. Not sure if that's true but I don't Wana take any chances. Did not have a good experience with the product.

For the price, these headphones are really quite good. I really appreciate that each one has a different volume control, and they can be worn together or solo. I purchased these headphones to wear listening to music and podcasts while doing chores or working out. The charging case is a good size - not so small you'll lose it but still fits in a pocket. I did have one little flub where it almost seemed like they were cutting out from each other while I was wearing them. I charged them, and it solved the issue, so who knows? They're fine now. The battery life seems a little shorter than expected, but they still last a long time. I do love that you can charge the case! They are also very comfortable, and I don't feel like they're going to fall out of my ears even when running. All in all, they're worth every cent, and I'm very pleased!

These headphones sit very well in my ears without being too tight. The sound quality is amazing, and I can listen to my podcasts without having the volume on my phone all the way up. The mic works really well too. All my phone calls are crystal clear and I can answer and hang up with the press of a button. It works so much better than other earbuds I've tried that have you tap it like a fish in an aquarium. I really recommend these headphones, especially when wearing a mask can have other earbuds fall out.

I do intense workout and the headphones would keep falling out. I used all of the earpieces and none of them worked it would still fall out it was very frustrating especially during cardio. I ended up paying the big bucks for a Beats version by Apple, and all I got to say is, "you get what you pay for". I haven't had one issue with the Pro Beats and yes it stays in your ear the whole entire time during intense exercising.

I have tried numerous other  kind/types of ear buds and had returned all of them because of the way they fit/sound/or other negative issues. Yours is the only one I would rate at delivering what you suggested on the Amazon description and more. What I mean is no other ones give me the length of play back time yours does the volume control, sound, fit, especially when you are active. Neat display of battery levels. Ease of connecting to recharge by type "C" USB. And most important at a affordable price. My opinion those high level earbuds that cost 5 times(like Apple) more than  yours. Don't even come close to what your OCCIAM offers. As you can tell I am very unpaid happy/satisfied customer.

Bad quality of life features. They don't turn off automatically when you put them in a case, so you can end up accidentally draining the headphones and the case if you forget to manually turn each one off. The connection is spotty, and the sound will randomly cut out on one side or the other. This makes using one earpiece for cycling or phone calls basically worthless. The true indication of the quality of this headphone is that I was relieved when they died after 5 months so I could justify replacing them with something better.

I was so excited to get these. They fit snug on the ears and don‚Äôt budge at all while I‚Äôm running. The charge is excellent and the charging case holds a charge for a long amount of time, but I am not happy with them. Sound cuts out on these constantly, which defeats the whole purpose of having headphones. Even on a full charge the sound starts to cut out and sounds like bad reception and one of the headphones just turn off while using it and I have to push the button on the side to turn it back on. I‚Äôve used it with a new iPhone and the new Apple Watch 6 series. I don‚Äôt have this issue with other Bluetooth headphones and those devices. The sound quality is decent when they work, but it‚Äôs a bummer to be running and just lose sound.

I have had these earbuds for about three weeks and so far they are great.  I use them several times per week and have yet to have to re-charge them.  The sound quality is good and I have not had any complaints from others while I have used them to make phone calls.  My favorite feature, which is becoming harder to find with earbuds, is physical buttons.  Many earbuds are touch sensitive and I have had poor experiences with those types of earbuds.  Even if you touch them just to make an adjustment, you risk disconnecting a call, changing a song track, etc.  With the physical buttons on these earbuds I do not have to worry about that.  They are also very light-weight and comfortable.

They were great while they lasted, but that was only 4 months and one died.  I tried every reset procedure in the book, but it's gone.  Gone, I say.  May it rest in peace.  But you, o wise consumer, should heed my advice and not purchase or develop an emotion attachment to such a defective product. Update...contacted the seller who was kind enough to send me an identical replacement pair. And I mean identical. Even down to the left ear bud dying after only a few months in use. We buried it next to it's cousin. Again, I warn you, steer clear of these earbuds!

At first great, but now each one seems to charge at a diff speed or hold a diff amount of charge. They last about 3hrs continually. But one dies faster that the other even though they're both at 100%. As a sound engineer it could be that one channel received more audio output, but I don't think that's the case. They're stereo headphones. They also seem not to stay in my ears while moving around which is frustrating, but I have small ear canals and am using the smallest fittings...I just don't know if I can recommend these to anyone. Idk how you can tell what percentage each headset is holding, but the case charge had a digital readout for the case itself only.

The sound has been great on the listening end! I have worn them outside in our awful wind and the only time I have complaints from someone I am talking to is when the wind truly is awful (for example sustaining winds of 20+ mph and also gusts...not uncommon for us to get 50+ mph gusts here and we have nothing around to block the wind either). I recently used these while operating my milking machine (rated at 91 dbs) inside our cleary built garage and I could be heard pretty easily over the machine still! Initially you get a pretty great charge out of the earbuds and the case but after probably a week or so of steady use the charge is not near as great but still does the job! The fit is pretty good but ocassionally they want to fall off (could be because of my hair or glasses or cap I suppose??). Ocassionally when listening to YouTube I have to "close" the app and open in back up because the buttons for some reason don't want to function properly but then they work fine after that. Overall I would recommend these!

I bought these earbuds to wear on my runs.  Those expensive, hard , white earbuds are uncomfortable, and they want to fall out during my runs.  I bought the Occiam Bluetooth earphones back in February.  I was thrilled by the sound and comfort of them.  They come in a charging case.  Fast forward 2 months, and they will no longer charge. I have done a factory reset, cleaned the earphones to no avail.  My advice, they have good sound, comfort and not expensive, but don‚Äôt take the risk.  Look elsewhere.

I have had trouble with other ear buds staying in my ears.  I needed bluetooth earbuds for my computer, not necessarily for big sound for music. So I thought ear buds with ear hooks were a good idea.  Unfortunately the ear hooks prevent the "speaker" portion from seating deep into the ear canal.  As a result much of the volume and the sound quality is lost.  Although they are light and comfortable, the sound quality resulting from the poor fit is sub-par. The ear hooks make the fit very secure, however.  The pairing was very easy and the engineering seems excellent.  Will look for ear buds with better fit.

Sound quality is just OK. Left earpiece doesn‚Äôt stay in place for me when jogging and it also powers off and on frequently  after jogging for a while. Not sure if it‚Äôs from sweat/moisture touching the charging contacts but it‚Äôs extremely annoying. For the price they‚Äôre ok overall but they don‚Äôt work well for me so I‚Äôm returning them. I think a lot of the 5 star reviews on here are because the company promises a free gift if you write one.

These wireless headphones stay in great with their soft ear hooks and have an impressive sound quality/volume for the cost.  The battery indicator in the case goes the extra mile by giving you a reading on the case itself and each individual ear piece.  The package came with a little scratch card, and I won a second pair!

With the market being hot for wireless headphones and being a bit of a sound quality  freak, I didn't quite expect much from these because of their price, being you get what you pay for with most wireless headphones. I was blown away with these. I've had them.for over a month now and still have no zero faults. They sound amazing, and have amazing battery life. Yes, both earbuds and case have crazy long battery life, either bud can be used as mono mode, (some top brands can't), and they have a fast charge. I seriously reccomend these because they're comfortable, sound great, and the battery life is awesome. They're extremely simple to pair, all you gotta do is take the earbuds out of the case and they auto power on and go into pairing mode, and once they're paired, all you gotta do is take them out if the case and go. Extremely simple. These are a HUGE bang for you buck. I highley reccomend.

The only complaint I have is that cordless earbuds don't hang around my neck when not in use.  With that fake complaint said, these buds are outstanding in many ways.  The bud batteries last a long time.  So long that I don't yet know how long.  Recharging in the case is very convenient.  Wearing one or two buds is  useful.  Controls are far better than my prior buds.  There is no "redial" option, which I love having made many middle of the night "butt dials" with old buds.  I like charge level displays for both buds and case.  Sound quality is good. Well done for an inexpensive ear bud.

I went crazy trying to find the right bluetooth earclips for the gym. I bought the Beats Pro (+$200) and they were skipping on the bluetooth connection with so many in the gym on bluetooth. I tried these and same location same music device, :no skipping or pairing issues. Sound is to me within 80% of the Beats Pro. Additionally, i wear a sweatband for my cardio and with the Beats ,,,,as the sweatband gathered sweat and became heavier, it put enough pressure on the Beats earbud controls to trigger the pause function on the headphone itself. With these, the functions on the earbud itself require a dedicated "push" and also you have to hold down to activate a function. So no accidentally brushing the headphones and causing an unwanted mode change. I am very happy with this purchase.  The bass is good and also the volume can go loud against background noise in the gym. Make sure you try the various size buds included to get the best snug fit for the most bass experience. If you are looking for ear clip headphones that won't fall off, save yourself time and hassle. These are great. And I am a VERY picky guy and not shy about going through the hassle of a return. but i am KEEPING these.

These are good, but they sure don't last. My right one won't charge, and when I sit there and hold it in place for it to charge it says it's fully charged but it dies in 10 minutes.  and they disconnect randomly or shut off. For the price I guess this is to be expected? I mean, a few months worth of playtime? Even for cheap Chinese products I expected to get a year out of it.

Haven't even had these for 6 months and the left one broke. There is absolutely no noise canceling on these. The battery charge doesn't even last a full day. They will turn on sitting in the case and connect to the phone when I dont want it to

I am leary of pay for reviews stores so I will not leave a good review that isnt warranted. This time im happy to say it is. I have a hard time finding earbuds that work for me. for some reason most hurt my ears bad enough that I cant wear them, or the sound quality isn't there. These do both! I am on the phone all day with insurance carriers, I hear them fine and they don't ask me to repeat myself or complain of the call quality or of not being able to hear me. Battery's last at least all day (12-14 hours) maybe more but I havent gone past that. I am extremely happy with this purchase and I will be ordering a second pair for backup!!! get these, you won't regret it!

I can't believe all these 5 star reviews. This product didn't work for me out of the box. The volume up and down don't work properly. The sound quality is poor. I've had less expensive ear buds that had much better sound.  They feel cheaply made.

Do yourself a favor and bypass this worthless piece of junk.  The unit came fully charged but after the battery got low the buds would not charge in the charging case. I called Amazon Support and we tried a few things to get the ear buds charged but nothing worked.  It appears that the charging case was defective. Amazon offered me the options to take the refund or get a replacement item and I opted to take the refund. I read all the one star reviews And it appears that  I am not the only one who experienced charging difficulties. So unless you enjoy headaches I would avoid this product. And by the way the volume was not great. I can set the volume to half of what I had it for these  Buds  with other earbuds are you home and have a better listening experience. Let the buyer beware

I loved these earbuds..... While they worked. They are a good fit and volume is pretty decent. They worked great for almost a month. Now they disconnect intermittently. If it follows the other reviews then they will stop charging completely in a few days. I have been reseting and trying to fix for a few days but I found out today that my return window was 1 month which was 5 days ago. Earbuds that only last a month are a waste of money. I disregarded the negative reviews when I purchased these cause every electronic company will have some issues. Now I believe they have a quality control issue. 1-2 failing in a month is 1 thing but now reading they are tons of these failing in the first month. Save your money and buy a better brand with a actual warranty.

Great earphones! They are five star, top notch, top shelf, top of the line, luxurious, superb, superior, A++, highest quality, supreme value, 100% splendid, perfect tens across the board, flawlessly performing, copper bottomed, brass tacks, silver plated, golden gilded, worth twice as much as the price, royal flush, sleek design, stylish form factor, second to none second quality, smooth hand-offs, intelligent Bluetooth handling, commendable range; the best of all earphones I have bought; the only thing missing is a tag in the earphones to keep track of them for ADD people like me! @omnicadabra

This is my first pair of having earbuds.  I've always be skeptical about earbuds because it doesn't appear that they'll stay in your ear so, the wrap around ear piece is a plus for me.  Also, I love the fact that these earbuds can be used either together or independent of each other.  Very easy to sync to my phone and the quality of sound is not bad.  The charger case gives you the exact battery strength as well.  I'm totally satisfied at this point!

Day 1 and great so far nice sound, good connection and stays in my ear Update: Day 4 and sound quality is as bad as the cheap ones I was replacing. They do fit nicely in my ears and music seems to do alright but I chose the wrong product for what I need. Just because they are capable of answering calls and talking to Google Assistant doesn't mean they are good at it. I love the buttons though; I would hang up on someone every time I adjusted my earbud with the touch controls. The left earbud stopped connecting  at all unless the right one was on. On paper these look awesome... to achieve those lofty goals either costs more money or development

I was a little upset to see that they give you a card for amazon gift card only if you give a 5 star rating, so I decided to wait in order to leave an accurate review. My headset was working good but then after 3 uses they would start to cut out and have a static noise to them. The right one would cut out completely and then return. It‚Äôs annoying.

These headphones are really bad. I was certain these headphones would be an upgrade to some old ones I‚Äôve had a couple of years, new product I wanted to try and my goodness it‚Äôs not good. The sound quality is subpar, music isn‚Äôt clear it always sounds muddied and my old ones (which were cheaper mind you) sounded far better. Idk if my ear stopped working but I hadn‚Äôt thrown out my two year old headphones yet and they sound infinitely better. People sound muffled over the phone, just bad overall. When I‚Äôm on a phone call I‚Äôm at the beach, not because the quality is so great that I‚Äôm making trying to make this horrible comparison like it‚Äôs a good thing, it‚Äôs that it‚Äôs so bad I needed to make a bad comparison. I sound like I‚Äôm underwater when there‚Äôs silence, and can‚Äôt be heard at all if I‚Äôm outside and it‚Äôs windy. Hence, beach.... not in a good way. At least it‚Äôll hold a charge for a long time! But what‚Äôs the point of a headphone that‚Äôll last for hours if it sucks this bad?? The case doesn‚Äôt die for a long while, headphones last like a whole 7 hours of use. These would be fantastic, if they were so horrid. Wait wait wait, maybe you got a bad one! Maybe this is just a faulty set of headphones and a replacement will do me good! I THOUGHT SO TOO!! But guess what?? The replacement was just as bad as the first, needless to say I‚Äôm disappointed, next time I‚Äôll be sure to not switch brands I guess.

I ordered this item based on the high number of positive reviews.  I liked how light they were when delivered and seemed to feel comfortable when I tried them on.  The case was a little flimsy but didn't seem overly so.  The biggest problem is that the volume options do not work with my iPhone 12 at all.  The sound can be adjusted from the phone itself but if I try to adjust them from the headphones the volume slider would flash on the phone and then nothing would change.  I called in and troubleshot the first pair and agreed to an exchange as I wanted to use these for running.  The second pair arrived quickly but had exactly the same problem.  No choice but to return them.  They were unfortunately a total waste of time.

I‚Äôve owned 4 different pairs of wireless headphones now and all of them felt pretty much the same until these. Each headphone can operate on its own meaning you can listen to either one without needing the other out of the case and switching to both is as easy as taking the other out. The battery life is great, I‚Äôve yet to have one die on me from a full day of listening to it, the power display doesn‚Äôt show a percentage for the headphones (just the case) but give bars in 25% increments. The only negative I have is the sound quality. Don‚Äôt get me wrong they sound good but for certain ear types you may experience the audio having a slight...muted sound to it. It‚Äôs an easy fix though if you mess around with your music players EQ Settings All around best bluetooth headphones I‚Äôve used.

** Edit April 11, 2021 ** Customer support via email was amazing, but these earbuds just don't seem to want to work more than a few months. I ordered these for the first time back in 2020, and i loved them. Worked PERFECTLY. Easily gave a 5 star review, even won a free 2nd pair. Satisfied customer. Until the charging case stopped working. I contacted their support team via email and after sending a video as proof, they had no problem sending me a new pair, and assured me they were working on fixing the issue. They may still be working on it, but here we are a few months into my 2nd pair, and the charger box is broken, once again. No lights, no charging. I believe it happened after I tried charging the box itself. Bottom line is: These earbuds were amazing, especially for the price, And 5 stars for customer service. But until they figure out why the charging case randomly stops charging, these earbuds are just dead and useless clutter :( * Original Review in 2020, 5 stars * Amazing wireless earbuds!! Highest quality for the most affordable price out of all the others here on Amazon. The packaging was the same level of quality as my Samsung Galaxy Watch!! No regrets, hands down a great affordable set of earbuds.

They fit nicely, cancel noise pretty well, have pretty good sound, calls are nice and clear, connect fast and last over 8 hrs plus the casing is fast charging and durable, neat how it tells the individual earpiece battery as well as the case battery. Does have some drawbacks as you would expect, it sometimes cuts off for a second varying amount of times(no more than 3 as of now) and not as much bass(for those who like at least a little more bass than usual with their music) and the main button is hard so pressing it shoves the earpiece in my ear(sucks and hurts as you'd imagine)

I thought the description claimed that these had a long battery life. Not so! If I charge the today and don't use them for a day with them fully charged, there's only half the battery life left when I am ready to use them. That's so disappointing. So, I only get half the battery life which is used up in one or two lengthy conversations. False advertising and unfortunate because otherwise they were exactly what I was looking for.

For Christmas my mom wanted a set of wireless earbuds that she could use while working out. Normally she listens to music, or watches a show while on the treadmill. She didn't want super expensive ones, so I thought these would be perfect. She thought these would be exactly what she needed, and charged them right up. After just her first time using them they were not as expected. They barely had any sound, one of the sides kept saying "power off" and "power on" so she had to go with just one side. She didn't understand because she had connected them to her phone, and charged them up fully. She does not use them anymore, after she gave them multiple chances. Even if the one side wasn't acting up they would still not work well based on the sound quality and comfortability.

Didn‚Äôt much care for the foily coil sound that would be produced if I turned my head a certain way and I honestly didn‚Äôt think the sound quality was anything special as well as the bass. More often than not that foily coil in the earbuds wouldn‚Äôt set right and I‚Äôd have to adjust them to achieve the proper sound and I didn‚Äôt like that. There are other TWS earbuds out there that are better imho but these seem to be adequate for a large chunk of people given the reviews. I used these until the better TWS earbuds that I ordered came from Amazon. Just wanted to try these out given they‚Äôre highly rated

Great value and the LED status on the charging case is great. We live on a sailboat which is where I use these most of the time, so I needed a pair that stays in place when in use. If they fall out, chances are they‚Äôre going for a swim. With these I never have to worry about that, and they‚Äôre still extremely comfortable. Battery life is great, so no complaints at all. I would definitely buy them again.

These are excellent earbuds. First time connecting was fast and easy. The best part is that if you use them with a certain device most of the time, they automatically connect to the last device. I use them mainly at work connecting to my phone to play music. I like the loops over the ears because my other earbuds fell out easily when I got up to walk to the copier! The sound quality is good and easy to adjust. The battery life is awesome! You can use one or both, charge one and use one. There is a display in the case to show the battery level.

These earbuds were easy to pair, the sound quality is great and they are very comfortable. I've been using them since the end of Jan and I absolutely love these. The sound is great. I can turn up the sound on either one or both. I can answer my phone or hang up using the right earbud. They are comfortable and the battery lasts a good long while before I have to charge the case. I put the buds in the case when I'm not using them so they are charged and ready to go when needed. I'm not able to use the ones that just sit in the ear as my ears are small. These also have different size caps to fit in the ear.

Update: started using these earphones in Dec 2020 and they were great. They were so great that I mentioned it to my friends and co-workers. Now its April 2021 and the left earphone is not working.  There is NO sound coming from the left earphone.  I have un-paired it from my phone and paired it back, but only the right earphone works.  This really is ***quite disappointing*** as I used these earphones almost everyday one at a time so that they last longer. So I have changed my rating from "5" to "2" stars because I only used the earphones for 4 months and now it doesn't work.  I expected the get more use out of them than 4 months. My Dec review is below: Just got these earphones and so far they are working great. I use them with my phone. Pairing was easy, and the battery life so far is good. Will update this in a month or two if anything changes.

Sound 6/10 Treble 9/10 Bass 5/10 (They aren't expensive...so don't expect expensive sound, but not bad or fuzzy at all) Microphone 6/10 Range of Bluetooth - 9/10 Surprisingly long range Battery 6/10 - They last for awhile, and the case battery is now having trouble keeping up with charging properly Fitment 9/10 - for my average sized ears, fall asleep in them and wake up with them still on. Noise Cancellation is passive, if they have active it's a joke. Don't use them for gaming, there's a crazy delay.

Poorly made product and design in comparison with other models on Amazon. Customer service was inconsequential. Although these were comfortable and had good sound, they would continually disconnect and power off. I tried everything from charging, to rebooting, to replacement. Nothing worked. I contacted Customer Support and was offered a  free replacement, to which I unfortunately agreed to. Same issues. The Occiam team offered to refund my money to ‚ÄúRemove The Negative Feedback From The Amazon Review Section‚Äù to which I agreed to. And the funds were never refunded to my account. So, I am rewriting the negative feedback to inform other consumers of the Occiam defects and poor customer service...I‚Äôve ended up ordering another brand and have been very satisfied

The product was bought to replace another brand that was not very good at all.  This product worked exactly how the manufacture said it would.  The ear pieces paired together right out of the case immediately without a problem.  After the two ear pieces paired then they both paired with my computer without a problem.  It was simple easy and quick.  The product has held a charge over at least 6 hours of continued use, the case has held a 90%+ charge over the past 3 days, even after charging the ear pieces twice during that period.  So far I like these.  This review is after using them for 3 days.

The audio is really good. Noise cancelation is possible, but I really have to wedge them in an uncomfortable way, or I have to deal with hearing Moana behind my music ü•¥ The biggest issue is that the volume control buttons do not work at all, and its a 50/50 chance whether the pause buttons work or not. It might be worth mentioning that my charging case had obvious moisture that could be seen on the LED screen from the minute I opened the box. I don't think that would affect the buttons on the actual headphones from not functioning properly, although I guess its possible. Since my charging case seems to hold a charge just fine (so far), it's not worth a trip to Kohl's to make the return.

I purchased these at the end of January and on June 19 the left side stopped working.  In addition whenever I take out the right earbud I hear "power on" instead of "connected" and evntually it too shuts off.  Amazon Customer Service was trying to put me in touch with the company but we were cut off. Before calling back I read the reviews and realized speaking with the company would be useless. The problem is universal. According to most of the negative reviews, after three to five months of use, the left side will stop working and you will have charging issues. Occiam management obviously has no shame since zero effort seems to have been made to correct the problem that everyone has. When these earbuds worked they were great for my needs but after less than five months they are junk taking up space.

I loved the earbuds while they lasted. I bought them Feb.8 and found they were comfortable and easy to use. Last week (June17) the charging case stopped taking a charge. Even after cleaning the connections as directed. Then yesterday as I unplugged the cord, the cord snapped off from the plug. No way to repair it, and since I was just unplugging in order to put the whole thing away indefinitely because it doesn't charge, it is a total loss. I will use the earbuds until they too lose power, then chalk it up as "buyer beware." I would recommend spending more and getting a better made product.

These headphones have held up well in the gym, but if you put your phone on DND like I do in the gym or during a meeting.  The headphones will still ring although it is on silent/DND which is very annoying.  The noise cancellation is very bad at filtering out high frequencies i.e. birds outside.  They also do not have a long range.  You can hear someone talking, but they can't hear you to well if you walk away.  Considering the price I am not sure if I should care, but considering these are WIRELESS lol .. I should be able to leave my phone a good distance.  This headset might go to 3ft max of uninterrupted space.

These would not stay charged and made noises as it was being charged. The case is supposed to charge the headphones, but it would not keep a charge. EDIT: The headphones were not working for my wife on her iPhone. I recently used them and the case does not stay charged longer than a day at most. I did not have issues actually using the headphones, but just know you cannot go more than a day without charging the case. I found the sound to be good and it was easy to use. Customer service contacted us about our concerns via email and did offer to return our money and said that they had reviewed our original concerns

UPDATE - Removing 2 starts. I Bought these specifically to use for phone calls and video calls based on reviews that people had a good experience. I am now getting feedback that people can not hear me on calls. They will be fine to wear for other activities but I will need to find something new for calls. (I tried Galaxy buds but they didn't fit my ears and then I lost one, so I'm going to research more.) --- These are very good for the price. Just was on the phone for 5 hours and the battery drained so I'd say they have 5 hours, not 8. They are mostly comfy but they do feel a little big where they insert into the ear. They came with 2 extra earbud covers but they all look the same size to me. I will have to search for other smaller earbuds (covers)t to see if they are more comfortable. The first call I made the other day the caller said the sound wasn't good. All other called said it is fine. I've had a little connection problem where they didn't show for my phone but it had since worked fine. I don't think the noise cancellation was good. A caller told me they thought the sounds on my end were too much when I had my window open even though I didn't think the sounds were very loud.

bought these  6 months ago and think they are great except one thing that is really driving me nuts. I listen to audio books while walking or biking and no matter what my volume is set at when I get a call on phone it goes full blast it just blares INCOMING CALL and I can't turn it down once I answer  the volume is normal.

Positives: battery life was surprisingly good. Bluetooth connection was easy to set up and connected quickly during use. Charging was easy and quick. Negatives: sound quality isn't great. None of the three provided earbud tips fit well.  I was constantly adjusting the earbuds while in my ears to try to get a better fit and better sound. The case would only charge with the provided USB cable which was only 12 inches long, didn't work with my other USB cables. The earbuds frequently lost connection with my phone when the phone was in my pants pocket. The right earbud stopped producing sound after about 6 weeks of use, it turned on and off but didn't make any sounds. Overall the earbuds look good but don't perform well and don't hold up, stopped working after 6 weeks.  I won't be purchasing this product again.

The head phones are difficult to connect to different devices. It is not smart. I have bought much cheaper headphones that are able to switch from one device to another. This one u need to turn of the bluetooth from the device after u disconnect so that it can then connect to another. This is so frustrating compounded with the fact that when you scan for the headphones it takes a number of tries to appear. For the monies ($33) i paid for those headphones. I am very unhappy with it. The design also is uncomfortable.

I have had these ear pieces for about 3 weeks and I have not found anything I dislike about them.  Even the way they charge is great.  I place them back in their case and plug the charger into the case.  The case has an indicator that tells you when the charge is complete or notes the percentage of the charge.  They are not earbuds that fall out when they get wet or from a strong twist of your head.  I can walk, run, jog comfortably in them.  The sound is good and  if you only want to use one of the ear pieces, you can.  Each side works by itself which is great when I am driving because I need to hear the traffic around me.

Easy to set up and quickly pair. I read reviews that had trouble with charging about 75% but that's what the station battery level is. You need to charge the charging station first. The earbuds charged quickly and I like that they hook around my ear and won't fall off when mowing the lawn. I've only had them for a day and they've worked for Zoom meetings so I'm not wires to my laptop. It is a little strange that the left ear is on the right and the right ear is on the left in the charging station... but not end of world or anything.

Pairing took about 2 minutes to complete, and then I got to listen to the sound. For the price, you just can't beat these headphones! I was really impressed. I made a couple calls to friends and call quality was good on both ends as well. The case could use a little work; it's not very user friendly for arthritic hands. I haven't had them llong enough to run down the battery yet, so that's a good thing - seems like battery life is pretty darn good because I've been using them a lot during workouts and around the house cleaning. I may even order a second pair to use just for my tablet while watching movies in bed at night so I won't be a disturbance! Love them!!

This is not a full review, that will come later. The product arrived on time and was as described. Everything is in working order and I'm able to connect to my iPhone and use them while working out The controls (audio level and connect/disconnect) work, They are comfortable with the over-the-ear hook nonintrusive. I like that they don't come out while I'm walking.  The sound is OK for what I purchased them for. I'll post another review in a month or so. So far have used them for up to 2.5 hours and still had battery life in them.

The upside: these pair instantly, are easy to charge, the case makes them convenient to transport. The sound quality is fine for cheap earbuds. The downside: The case is extremely flimsy--any time it falls, it breaks in half. Additionally, the earbuds are uncomfortable if you have small ears. They did not come with varying sizes of tips like earbuds normally do--the basic ones are too big for me. I got smaller tips separately, but these are still not comfortable for extended periods of time. Finally, it's quite strange that the left piece goes on the right side of the case, and the right piece goes on the left. Are these a decent alternative to airpods? Sure. But if something happened to these, I would look elsewhere for a replacement.

Firstly, the sound is awesome. I've struggled to find a good headphone when it comes to call volume and these are wonderful in that respect, loud enough, rich enough and the person on the other end never notices I am on headphones. My issue is with charging.  I love that the case readout that indicates charging and battery life.  The case must be charged to full each day, sometimes twice.  The headphones also dont remain "off" all the time when you turn them off and put them in the case, so they will drain it pretty fast, and then run out themselves.  If I am going to be using them a lot during a given day, making sure they are charged is a hassle- the case only seems to charge off of USB C cords plugged directly into a surge protector, if there is an adapter at all they dont charge. Sound is great, very comfortable, charging is pain.

I love these earbuds! The ear hooks fit very comfortable over my ears which helps me control how much of the bud is inserted in my ear without  worry that they will fall out. I mainly use them for listening to music/audiobooks and phone calls and I am very satisfied with the sound quality. I rarely use both L and R at the same time so I save a lot of battery life alternating them. It‚Äôs also really helpful that the case shows how charged each bud is as well as how charged the case is. As for fit these are the first ones I would actually recommend to a friend.

These are okay, just okay though. As far as for sports or even going for a run, absolutely do not purchase. I find myself having to push these back into my ears constamtly on a moderately brisk walk; I couldn't imagine running with these on. The wrap around ear piece doesn't mold to your ear or anything. Just a flap of rubber that for some reason clears the top of my ear by about 1.5 cm, I assure my ears are not small. If the rubber piece that wraps behind the ear had a wire in it to hold the ear buds to your ear it would make a huge improvement. And perhaps do something about that big gap at the top of the ears. The ear wrap should rest on top of the ears. These are solely supported by the ear buds themselves until they slide out at which point the sound quality becomes greatly compromised as the ear buds are no longer in your ears but resting just on the cusp. The angle of the ear buds in relation to the rest of the device is a tad awkward as well. Was really expecting to get more for the price I paid. These are at best okay for going for a walk on a light breezy evening. When sitting completely still and the ear buds actually stay in place inside my ears the sound quality is wonderful. Trust me though; you do NOT want these for running or sports.

For the money and description, I expected better.  When I went running with them the first day.  After about 25 mins they started to disconnect then connect.  They were fully charged so I know battery was not the issue.  The only thing I could check, are they sweat proof.  The set I have seems to not be very sweat resistant, I was able to make them shut off with just a little sweat on the connectors. Update: right ear no longer charges. I checked to see if the terminals were clean but the right side will not charge.

Although there are many nice features in these ear buds, for some reason they would disconnect and reconnect repeatedly during use. I have other Bluetooth earbuds and do not have this problem. I have also been told that the sound quality is poor for people on the other end of a phone call.  Unfortunately if call sound quality is low and it cannot connect and remain connected, all of the other features are meaningless.

Excellent. Lightweight and comfortable on the ears. The hook is flexible and soft which makes it a plus. I am able to literally shake my head and the earbud stays in and on my ears.  The sound is good and you don't have to turn it up very high to hear it. The display is bright and easy to read, really helpful for someone like me that uses corrective lenses. The price is great too, I paid double what this cost for another brand earbud that had the same quality.  Would DEFINATELY buy again....because I bought for husband and I can't keep them.  :-)

Battery last a long time but that is pretty much the only upside to these. The volume control on the headsets do not work, I thought it was only on my phone because I have a Razer Phone 2 so I thought maybe it was that buy my wife has a Samsung and it does not work on that either. Also each time you put them back into the charger it takes about 25 percent of the battery so a fully charged case you should probably get 4 charges off of it making them last for 32 hours or so total.

I hate to write a bad review of the product. This requires that I have to relive the disappointment but I wish somebody would‚Äôve told me before bought this product that the battery life sucks. They connect wonderfully. I love that either one can connect independently of the other. The sound quality is great. Maybe they are great for music but I don‚Äôt use them for that. I talk on the phone a lot and these are the worst Bluetooth earphones as far as battery life that I ever owned. Two hours of talk time then ‚Äúbattery low‚Äù warning comes on and maybe five more minutes then they die. I have to charge them 3 times a day. Maybe I got a bad batch as I did not see this issue in other reviews. Other than battery life they are fantastic. If you can‚Äôt enjoy them for very long then the whole experience suffers. FYI, I have owned these for about three weeks now.

After testing on a brief video chat, I used these to deliver a training at work.  I noticed that trainees were dropping out mid-meeting and saw the chat messages that my audio was breaking up.
